results.description:
Hi, my name is Renat. I started this meetup group because I want to help OpenAI fulfill its mission (I’m not affiliated with the OpenAI non-profit organization). When I was in college, the world of artificial intelligence fascinated me. So I was applying Neural Nets to data sets generated by e-commerce websites (using Kohonen’s Self Organizing Maps).

It was 1999. Looking back, I realize that my research is a joke compared to what you can do today.

What becomes possible tomorrow is super exciting and scary at the same time. That is why I decided to contribute my time and evangelize importance of this non-profit organization among artificial intelligence enthusiasts in New York. Specifically, I will be finding and securing physical locations where members of this group could meet in person, share and discuss ideas.

If you care to help - drop me a line with any ideas or suggestions you might have. Or simply say hello and introduce yourself because I would like to learn about you and the projects you are working on! See you soon!

Disclaimer: This Meetup group is not affiliated with the OpenAI non-profit organization. This Meetup group does not own the OpenAI trademark; this Meetup has no affiliation, connection or association with such third party; Such third party has not approved nor sponsored this Meetup group's use of the trademark in any way.
results.name: OpenAI New York

For those who are good without a god. This assembly isn't to trash other religions or to bash others beliefs in god, but more concentrate on what does exist: the world around us, the people in it, and how we can live through compassion and empathy to make it better. Some Humanists are atheists, some are agnostic, but overall we feel man created god and it's not necessary to believe in supernatural beings. God didn't make man; man made gods.

This network is for those who stand behind values above beliefs. Anyone with a positive or curious attitude is welcome to join.

Exploring Humanism

Meetups shall consist of Humanist reading material, personal testimonies, interviews, friendly debates, etc. 

“Even if things don't unfold the way you expected, don't be disheartened or give up. One who continues to advance will win in the end.” 

“I am a humanist, which means, in part, that I have tried to behave decently without expectations of rewards or punishments after I am dead.”

results.description:
Who We Are

Maasai Mamas of Bedford-Stuyvesant is a Mother's group committed to building community with like-minded mothers who believe in advocacy on behalf of children.  

We aim to raise our children in a community of activists where we promote the principles of humanity and compassion through grassroots organizing, play dates, community events and fellowship.

Why Maasai Mamas?

We call ourselves, Maasai Mamas, in honor of the mighty warriors of the Maasai tribe of Africa. The Maasai are known for their remarkable accomplishments but are particularly noted for their highly feared and intelligent warrior class. Surprisingly enough, the traditional greeting passed between Maasai warriors is "Kasserian ingera" which translates to mean "and how are the children?"


How are the children?


How are the children? 


The renowned warriors of the Maasai tribe's first order of business are the children. The proper response (whether a parent of not) is "all the children are well." 


But all the children are not well and therefore #TheMaasaiMamasAreComing. 


Personal Reflections

One thing I have learned on my motherhood journey, is that there isn't a force in this World that is more determined and/or powerful than a mother who is protecting her young. Maasai Mamas of Bedford-Stuyvesant is a Mother's group committed to building community with like-minded mothers who believe in social justice and want to raise their children amongst a community of social activists.


The Birth of Maasai Mamas of Bedford-Stuyvesant 

My first time hearing the Maasai greeting was on the Alex Haley Farm in Clinton, TN during the Children's Defense Fund's annual Ella Baker Child Policy Training Institute. Every year, Freedom School leaders, servant leader interns, educators, Ella Baker Trainers, and community partners gather on the Alex Haley Farm, under the phenomenal leadership of Marian Wright Edelman to learn and study how to organize and advocate on behalf of children. We self-identify as #ChildDefenders...and that is exactly who we are and what we do! 

My first year on the farm I was 6 months pregnant. That was the same summer the Trayvon Martin verdict was announced. I felt hopeless, emotional and unable to advocate and defend my people because at that time, I was carrying my daughter and it was too risky to participate in the national protest and demonstrations that were taking place across the country. 

I had to change my "activism" strategy. 

During the following summer, Michael Brown was gunned down with his hands in the air...my daughter was an infant. Still not able to protest and demonstrate the way I wanted. I organized a mother's group in Baltimore, MD had over 100 mothers, but could not effectively leverage meet-ups around social-action. 

I had to change the strategy. 

This spring (in my daughter's birthplace, Baltimore, MD), Freddie Gray was murdered. Baltimore was burning as I was driving to Brooklyn, NY for a job interview. My phone was ringing off the chart with people asking me if my daughter and I were okay, asking for first hand accounts of what was happening in Baltimore...meanwhile I am driving up I-95, CRYING...still trying to figure out my place in this movement as both a mother and community activist. 

And thus...Maasai Mamas of Bedford-Stuyvesant was born.
results.name: Maasai Mamas of Bedford-Stuyvesant

results.description:
"The task of an activist is not to navigate systems of oppressive power with as much personal integrity as possible; it is to dismantle those systems.” Lierre Keith, co-author of the book Deep Green Resistance

Radical Feminist Activists Meetup Group (RadFem) was founded in 2011 and has hosted almost 200 Meetups of all sorts and had garnered more that 550 supporters. Sadly, our previous organizer shut it down on New Year's Day 2016 (despite a stated intention not to do so), thereby wiping out all files, studies, reports, photos, discussions, e-lists, event history... and the entire institutional memory of the group. This represented the collective product of many feminists over a number of years.

This valuable resource was created for the benefit of, and was open to, the entire Feminist community, members and non-members alike. It will take some time, but we will rebuild both the site and the collective inclusive spirit of the group. Silence in not an option.

Please be a feminist or open to feminism if you join. There are plenty of other groups to join if you are neither. Beyond that, we welcome feminists of all stripes, colors, creeds, and gender identities who are committed to challenging, confronting, and ultimately dismantling Patriarchy. Together we hope to forge a path to sexual equality and gender justice for all, not just by talking among ourselves, but by speaking out, writing, marching, demonstrating, protesting and actively projecting a loud and fierce voice in opposition to Rape Culture and the War on Women.

Male supremacy must end. Oppression and violence is not natural or inevitable. Neither is patriarchy or any collection of interlocking/intersecting systems of oppression. Radical Feminism, in the truest sense of the word 'Radical', is about going to the root of the systems of oppression that we all participate in and perpetuate, creating change from the ground up and making the world a better,  more equitable, non-oppressive place.

We believe change is not only possible but probable and above all necessary. Radical Feminist Activists is a place for Radical Feminists to gather, consciousness raise, get creative, share stories, and engage in activism in New York City and beyond. Please join us in this struggle.

Issues we care about (not exhaustive):

- Men's violence against women
- Domestic violence
- Rape and sexual abuse
- Sex trafficking
- Childhood sexual abuse (CSA)
- Female Genital Mutilation (FGM)
- Racism
- The wage gap and the glass ceiling
- Sexual harassment and stalking
- Homophobia, transphobia, and violence against lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and sex/gender nonconforming people
- Femicide 
- Pornography
- Prostitution and sex work (discrimination against sex workers by choice as well as sexual slavery)
- Sex/gender roles and stereotypes
- Sexism in media and advertising
- Global solidarity
- Intersection w/ race and class oppression
- History of feminist theory and what sets Radical Feminism apart

Join us to plan activist events and projects; get together to discuss feminism, current events, and anything else of interest; plan creative projects like advertising campaigns, videos, stories, spoken word and poetry; and start activist actions on issues that matter to us all!

Peace, Justice and Freedom...
results.name: Radical Feminist Activists

A good avenue to share experiences, know-how and experiences from real life challenges. “Agile adoption in Startup has two challenges, the first one is choosing the right agile methodology that would suit the startup’s requirements and the next key challenge is implementing the agile methodology in right way and getting the expected results. 

Startups are always constrained by budget limitations and cannot afford to engage agile coaches to adopt agile methodologies.” We aim to be inclusive and all agile enthusiasts are welcome, regardless of their experience levels, the size of their team or the business they are in. 

Let’s join together and make Startups successful using Agile.

results.description:
From television to the Internet, the widespread adoption of new technology historically requires great, original content fueling adoption. Virtual and Augmented Reality will prove no different, and everything old is new again. I know -- I also run New York's 3D Printing Entrepreneurs, Breakfast with Founders, am a global intellectual property and technology attorney, and the Founder of a 3d printing consultancy, Transcend 3D.

Virtual Reality content lends itself to "first person account" in a way in which preceding technologies never have. It forces the user to look around, and when they do there better be some content to discover. It's a new way of storytelling and it is utterly unexplored. So you must be a Pioneer. Up for it?

New York has long-enjoyed status as a premier city for content creation, from advertising to television and film. Let's not drop the ball, People. Come join the Reality Revolution; Come join VRCC.

results.description:
Interested in learning a different kind of martial art? Learn non-aggressive self defense that will help you feel more at peace in daily life. Develop calmness and relaxation in a friendly and supportive environment. Age, size and gender make no difference.

Aikido is a Japanese martial art with techniques based on unarmed Samurai combat.

Aikido training offers the opportunity to learn how to control ourselves, so that we are able to respond to any situation gently and with confidence both in and out of the dojo.

Aikido is not a striking or kicking art. It teaches how to get out of the way of an attack and keep yourself safe. Learn techniques that take your attacker's balance, use their negative energy to your positive advantage and disarm them without harming them.

Training includes stretching, breathing and centering practice, mind-body coordination exercises and martial arts tumbling and rolling practice.

New to Aikido?  Please join us for our next class.  Beginners are always welcome.
results.name: Aikido Kokikai of Queens

This is a forum and community of learners and users of Apache Flink in the New York City Area. Apache Flink is a multi-purpose Big Data analytics framework leading a movement towards the unification of batch and stream processing or stream processing-first in the open source.

With the many technical innovations Apache Flink brings along with its unique vision and philosophy, it is considered the 4 G (4th Generation) of Big Data Analytics frameworks providing the only hybrid (Real-Time Streaming + Batch) open source distributed data processing engine supporting many use cases: batch, streaming, relational queries, machine learning and graph processing.
results.name: New York City (NYC) Apache Flink Meetup

results.description:
- Have you seriously thought about learning and speaking Mandarin but have no idea where and how to start? 

- Have you been signed up for the expensive courses but you got overwhelmed by the complicated characters, unfamiliar pronunciation and tones? 

- Have you ever wondering how can some people talk in Mandarin with confidence? ( and you want to do it too, but you are just a little bit shy and afraid of making mistakes ?) 

- Have you thought about hiring a tutor but not sure who is right for you and how much he/she can help you?

- Have you thought about going to a Chinese speaking event to practice your Chinese but you worry about people may not understand completely about what you say? May be you have been there once or twice but got intimidated by other people's " fluent" Mandarin? 

- Have you ever stood in front of the bookshelf and wondering which book you should pick?

 If your answer is " yes" to most of the questions, then this group is for you. Each week we select a topic and we will talk about it together, practice vocabulary, sentence structure and work on our pronunciation and tones with few other friends who are the same level as you ( 6 people maximum). I will handpick or create a material for you and personally guide you to have conversation in Chinese clearly and coherently. 

Whether you want to travel to China, expand your career opportunity, make Chinese friends, or simply interested this language, our goal is the same - we want to speak it well and be understood.  " Excuse me", " I am sorry", or " can you say it again" are the phrases we DON'T want to hear even if people speak it politely to us. 

A little bit about me: I am from North part of China and I am currently teaching part -time in a independent high school in Manhattan. Meanwhile, I am pursuing my second master's degree in instructional/ educational technology and I have been teaching/ tutoring children as well as adults for over five years.

Note: Our event/ lesson is for small group of people who need an experienced instructor to guide them work on their tones, pronunciation, grammar, vocabulary use so that they can have better conversations in Mandarin. Therefore, this event is NOT free. If you are looking for free event, then this group is not for you. And this is not a group for casual Mandarin conversation so it's not a group for native speaker either. 

Another note: My lesson is usually charged. However,  you are welcome to show up and try my lesson out! That means, if don't like it and decide not to come back again, then it's free of charge!!
results.name: NYC Mandarin Conversation

-Average length of the group could be 1.5 to 3 hours- How ever long we could stay focused

results.name: Hoboken FAR CPA Study Group

results.description: “This is a group for anyone interested in Networking with like minded people in Health and Wellness who are looking to also meet Business professionals to grow mutually.  This is a Meetup open to All Professions and people who are givers.  I started this group because I wanted to be the Bridge between Health and Wellness Professionals, Practitioners, Product and Service providers to meet Corporate Professionals.  Everywhere I Network I see that real need of introducing the two realms.  i.e. The Dentist to meet a CPA not to sell to each other but to introduce each others Clients to each other.  I know it may seem obvious to you but it is not in real life.  The Dentist sees many people that need their Taxes done and the CPA meets many people that might complain about a tooth ache.  You ge the gist.  Zig Zigler said "If you help enough people to be successful you will be more successful"  That is what I want to do for You.  You can contact me directly and we can talk about how I can support you?  Or come meet me in person at one of the events.  I hope to meet you soon.

results.description: I've tried this before with no luck, but I'd like to see if we can get this off the ground. I would love to put together a weekly blues jam/blues workshop. THIS IS NOT MEANT FOR BEGINNERS OR EVEN ADVANCED BEGINNERS. I mean no disrespect but I am not setting this up as a workshop for people just learning their instruments or who have never played with other musicians. If any of you have tried to do this you will know how hard it is to get quality drummers or bassists so here is your carrot! The rest of us guitarists, keyboardists, harp and horn players will pay an equal share.

Where do you turn to when a relationship has become hurtful and filled with bitterness? If you're seeking answers about why relationships fail and want to stop unhealthy patterns, you come to this meetup with your list of questions.  Learn how to break "bad" communication habits that cause havoc.  

This group is open to anyone seeking resolve from contentious relationships.  It doesn't matter if you're in a relationship, separated, divorced, have conflict with ex spouses, family and or children.   Learn how hurt, disappointment and frustration can lead to anger, bitterness and negativity in relationships.  Rather than blaming why not learn to resolve conflict and find happiness?

results.description:
Hello Long Island Event Planners!

Thank you for checking out our meet up! We are currently in the process of starting an Event Planning Expo business and we are currently seeking independent event planning businesses who will be willing to vendor for us. Whether you're already in business, just starting a business, or would like to promote it, all types are welcomed!

Planning a wedding or event these days can be a nightmare! Especially when you don't know where to find event planners. You would have to call businesses, have them come to your home or office at a time thats never convenient, find people online without visual aids, etc. The whole idea of this business will be where event planners of all kind can all come together, set up a table, showcase their business, reveal samples and visual aids, hand out business cards, meet clients face-to-face, sell stuff and book events, all at once! We would like this Event Planning Expo to take place at a park in the spring and summer time and at a hotel banquet hall in the fall and winter.

We are looking for the following:

-Photographers

-DJs

-Tent rentals

-Limousine rentals

-Caterers (Sample and sell your own food)

-Wedding Gown/Tuxedo fitters

-Wedding ring fitters

-Party Favor suppliers

-Novelty Concession Stands (popcorn, cotton candy, snow cone machines etc.)

-Ice Cream Trucks

-Wedding Cake Designers

-Ice Sculptures

-Florists

-Travel Agents

-Characters (Mascots, Clowns)

-Magicians

-Candy Buffet Suppliers

-Balloon Suppliers/Balloonists

-Animal show businesses

-Inflatable rentals

-Spray Paint Artists

...Anything Event Planning related!

Our goal for the Expos is to help other businesses promote their own, to make it convenient for people (guests who attend) to plan their own events with as little stress as possible and to also be a place where families and friends can come and have fun! The way you earn money is entirely up to you! Whether it's selling food, booking events with a down payment, selling bracelets for all day access to the moon bouncers for the kids, etc. We would like to hold meet ups at least once a month, so we will have more vendors at each Expo. Thank You for your time and we hope to see you at our meet ups!

Thank You for your time and we look forward to getting to know each and every one of you and hopefully have an opportunity to work with you all!
results.name: "Vend & Attend" - Long Island Event Planning

results.description:
Our Bible Study fellowship for the purpose of spreading the Gospel message of Jesus Christ to those who may have lost their way or don't know Him as their personal savior.  This mission is performed through our life changing worship experience, bible study and creative outreach programs.

Matthew 28:19-20 (NIV) "Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you"

Bible study reveals a plan and purpose for every person's life. The knowledge and understanding gained from the study of God's word can give you a better understanding of your life and its events.  Often we ask ourselves questions about life. We wonder about the purpose of our lives. We question whether our lives have meaning.  Study of the bible gives us special insight into the answers to these questions. You may not understand the bible, and are confused by the Bible's many interpreters. Some of you may have given up on the bible because you think you need to be a specialist to understand it. The bible is for everyone and everyone who studies it can master its message.  Our bible study is open all.  It will help you to have a better life, a deeper understanding of your purpose and a greater knowledge of just how important your life really is. Bible study is also a great opportunity to fellowship with like believers. Sharing with both new and mature believers is an opportunity to encourage each other to stay on track with our God-given assignments.
results.name: Bible Study Meetup

results.description: I'm a jazz drummer and bandleader with a deep knowledge of the New York jazz scene who would like to share both my music and the music that I go to hear for inspiration with the Meetup community. I'll be organizing two kinds of events: (1) Free events featuring my own bands at venues that don't charge a cover. Each of these bands have been playing together for years and include some of the best musicians in town, so you can be assured of world-class music. (2) Events at New York's top jazz venues featuring music and musicians that I turn to for inspiration. Most of these will have a cover charge. All of these events will be preceded by a dinner where everyone can have an opportunity to meet each other and discuss the music and musicians at the evening's event. In some instances the venues themselves have restaurant, and we can simply arrive early; in others, I'll select an interesting restaurant nearby. On my gigs, don't be surprised if we are joined by some of the other musicians in the band!
results.name: NYC Live Jazz Meetup: Live Jazz, Dinner And Discussion

results.description:
This group is created for parents who would like to throw birthday parties for their child(ren) but barely has anyone to invite. It’s no fun when you want your child to feel extra special and have a great time on their day, but lacks the social (interest) network to pull it off. We could give them the most expensive gift and try to make them feel special, but nothing makes a child feel more special, than being recognized and supported by a party gathering group – just for them!

Let’s help them create memorable memories!  Let’s celebrate with them! Let’s be that support system for that boy or girl who would otherwise watch his or her birthday come and go unnoticed.

Age Groups: 1 – 4, 5 – 8, 9 – 12, 13 – 16, 17 - 19

How it works: The parent(s) who is having a birthday party would make it known here, listing the child(ren) age(s) (or age group), venue, date, time, etc along with their child(ren) Wish List within 1 month minimum of event date. Parents with children in the same age group would be the most fitting to attend the event, but all group members welcome. Parents are responsible for their own party preparation, venue vetting, and everything to get the party in swing. We (group members) are here to support each other’s children by being present at their party with gifts and cheers. However, parents may reach out to group members – individually to seek help with their child’s party prep – if needed. Children in the same age group may also be able to do some activities at the event with the birthday girl or boy, so really, feel free to reach out. Who knows? We may even have some party event planners joining us!

We are a support system, so please feel free to share any suggestion(s) or recommendation(s) you have.

I look forward to us having great times. Cheers!
results.name: Children (Toddler, Pre-teen, Teen) Party Network NYC Metro

A snack or bottle of wine (but hopefully you bring wine). 5:45-6:00: Meet n' greet 6:00-6:30: Writing Exercise (We will all share this) 6:30-7:30: Workshop (Everyone has read and marked up/ typed up a half page critique for every other member's story/ piece). *If the group becomes too big, we will reorganize this aspect So excited to get this ball movin'

results.description: The NAAAP-NY chapter of Toastmasters International focuses on improving our professional communications by practicing in an inviting, cordial environment every 2 weeks. Selected members provide speeches (short or long) to other members, who will then receive feedback. If you thought of improving your communication, public speaking, or leadership skills through Toastmasters, this is a perfect opportunity to check out our club for yourself. Whether you are looking to develop your skills, ace a job interview, or ignite your career, Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. ABOUT NAAAP-NY NAAAP New York is the founding chapter of the National Association of Asian American Professionals (NAAAP). The organization was founded over thirty years ago, and today has thousands of members in 27 chapters across North America. As a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, NAAAP is dedicated to developing and advancing Asian Americans across all industries and career stages by providing premier career-oriented and cultural programming.

results.description:
This group is for those interested in spiritual growth. Our community focuses on the power of meditation, the study of truth and the vision of spiritual growth centered in divine love.  

In 2013, we began a metaphysical journey through the Bible, which will continue as long as it takes. 

In 2016, we are still journeying through the Old Testament. 

We have been meeting since 2007 and offer several opportunities for spiritual growth and development, including a Sunday Powerpoint Session at 2:30 PM, where we discuss the Bible (this session is a nontraditional approach to spiritual growth, which is usually facilitated by Rev. Cecilia Loving or Rev. Marlon Cromwell at the Unity Center of NYC). We also meditate, pray, and sing. Our meetings are "live-streamed" on www.truthunity.net whenever possible. Some sessions are available on www.spiritmuvvideo.com. We have two weekly prayer calls: one on Saturday mornings from 7 AM to 7:30 AM and one on Monday evenings from 8 to 8:15 PM. We also have a class on the teachings of Joel Goldsmith on Tuesday evenings from 8:30 to 9:30 PM and will be continuing to study Rev. Loving's book GOD IS A BROWN GIRL TOO once a month. Most of our members belong to our church SPIRITMUV.

results.description:
We are about business owners helping each other. 

Learn from other business owners and help increase the chances of success. Smaller business owners need all the help they can get. The SBA Government agency suggests more than 50% of new US companies fail in the first 5 years and a similar amount thereafter. The odds are stacked against new businesses and entrepreneurs. Understand and learn from owners who have experienced similar issues through business cycles from startup struggles to the relative utopia of predictable success. Gain exposure to other business owners in a collaborative, open and caring framework. Learning and sharing with other community business owners is an invaluable opportunity. This meet-up group provides a medium for entrepreneurs and business owners to reach one another, network, mentor, gain opportunities and forge relationships.

If you are thinking of starting a business, or maybe already operating and or growing a company you can benefit from other business owners knowledge and experience. Talent alone is often not necessarily enough to make a business work in the long run. Learn and share with others to help minimize poor decisions and optimize the opportunity for success. How did other business owners get the right funding, which digital marketing companies have burnt them, what CPAs or Attorneys are recommended, how do they recruit quality staff, why an LLC not a C corp. The list of questions is endless and diverse, many common to all businesses and some more specific and segmented by industry. The opportunity to accelerate your business through the community of other business owners knowledge is extremely powerful. We invite you to join to a network to help benefit you and other business owners in our communities.

Welcome everybody! I didn't really see any kind of group like this on Meetup, so I thought it'd be cool to have a slightly different video game based group on here! 

So this group is exactly what the title might suggest. Our meetups are centered around the great conversations we can have from talking about the games we've been playing as a group! This is meant to be a relaxing, casual get-together where you can meet new people, share a common interest with new friends, and maybe even learn some new things about your favorite game(s)! We encourage that everyone try and play the games we'll be talking about for yourselves but it's okay if you can't either. You might learn about their experiences in ways that you never would have gotten playing it yourself anyway. And we'll be trying to have meetups that can revolve around everyone playing something at the same time as well to spread events around the month. 

I do ask that everyone signing up for the group have a clear picture of themselves on their profile so that we can recognize members for each meetup. I'll be taking suggestions from the sign-up questions on what our games for each month are going to be, and we'll go from there. results.description:
•First and foremost, this is kind of an experiment for me - I was introduced to Meetup in 2015 and attended a whole bunch of Meetups, ranging from '80s dance parties to language events to ski outings, etc. I was trying to meet new and interesting people with an actual interest in making long term friends, but that didn't really happen. So, one of my resolutions for 2016 was to create this group and interact with sane, normal people looking to make genuine friendships.

I'm hoping there are some normal folks out there looking to make new friends, either because their old ones moved away, or their friends all got married and became boring, or through some crazy mishmash of circumstances find themselves without some solid people to hang with. 


This group is for those in their 20s/30s and fit the criteria below: 

• You are sane - this is rule #1; if you're a creep or a narcissistic psychopath, this isn't the Meetup for you, sorry.

• You're actually interested in building real, genuine friendships, and not here to meet some new people you hang out with for a month and then suddenly stop. (Of course, if you just don't click with them that's a different matter altogether).

• You are not a bigot - All are welcome as long as you're willing to try talking to new people and can respect others' viewpoints.

• You are single - as in, you're not engaged or married. I find married people are either busy doing nothing or doing their own thing that they forget about their friends (yes, this has happened to me). Sorry if you're married - hey, at least you've got your significant other to hang out with, right?

• You are not using this Meetup as some kind of dating venue - such activity won't be allowed. Besides, trying to sleep with your friends usually ends horribly. Many songs have been written about it - trust me on this one.
results.name: Sane People Who Want To Make Real, Genuine Friends

We encourage a supportive environment helping every person be more committed to an active and healthy lifestyle that includes running on a regular basis. We hope that running with our group becomes a great motivator for you to stay engaged in running/fitness and provides an exciting environment where you will have fun making new friends.


How often do we run together and where?  

We will be organizing runs in Prospect Park on Saturday mornings during April and May. 

We will be adding a weeknight to the mix starting in June. 


How long is a typical run?

We will generally plan to go for up to 45 minutes at a comfortable pace. 

We will do our best to accommodate the pace of all runners who are part of the pack. Depending on the fitness level and ability of our members, we will plan to adjust pacing and grouping to ensure everyone feels they're getting a good workout.

results.description:
Girlfriends Pray (GP) Local is everywhere, for every woman, in every season of her life! Once a month our Local Ambassadors host a Saturday morning meet-up in cities all around the world to discuss prayer, and connect with women in their local communities for fellowship, food, and fun on the strength of our faith.

It is the mission of Girlfriends Pray Ministries to get more women closer to God through prayer; and our vision is to get 1 million women around the world united in prayer. Although we are a non-traditional unconventional ministry with 80% of our service to women delivered virtually, in 2015 we expanded our service to women nationally and internationally off-line with our LIVE Breakfast Book Club (BBC) prayer groups. We encourage you to also partner with us as day after day we connect with women all around the global and come face-to-face with real life issues, challenges and the needs of women. So many women depend on Girlfriends Pray Ministries as a life line to God. Every day we see lives changed, lives impacted and souls led back to Jesus Christ through our local meet-ups and our prayer line, (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#. Here's a testimony from one of our girlfriends, Courtney -- “For those of you just joining Girlfriends Pray, if it had not been for God and this prayer line on my side …. Where would I be … in the grave by my own hand!”

We thank you in advance for joining us and your financial gift as an offering for the ongoing support of Girlfriends Pray Ministries. To become a partner please CLICK HERE.

We look forward to meeting you face-to-face at our next monthly meet-up.

Girlfriends Pray Local Ambassador Leadership Team
Praying Without Ceasing.... 1 Thessalonians 5:17
Girlfriends Pray Ministries
Prayer Line: (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#
Email: Local@GirlfriendsPray.org
Website: www.GirlfriendsPray.org
@GirlfriendsPray

results.description: This safe and inviting space where everyone can feel free to come as they are and move however they want. There is no judgment and the practice has nothing to do with being a "good" dancer. Dance is joyful and powerful, and it's definitely made all the richer when practiced in a group, where we reflect one another's beauty and hold space for each other's pain. To witness each other and to be seen, so that we can move through the world as our most authentic selves. It's a lot of fun, and also really cathartic, as we feel into our bodies and touch into the deepest parts of ourselves...igniting bliss and releasing any blocks we might be holding. This soulful dance party will draw from various traditions that can help fuel an awesome reconnection with body and soul, including 5Rhythms, Authentic Movement, Ancient Temple Arts, Qigong, and Meditation.

results.description:
Networking has become the cornerstone of all businesses and careers. Yet, the networking event has become a commodity. Many events around town focus on attracting volumes of attendees, exchanging business cards and potentially meeting someone new. Sure, it's great if your goals are aligned to any one or more of these results. However, you're probably asking yourself these two questions when you leave the event:

How many true connections did I make?
Was the event worth my time?

Chances are....you probably didn't get what you paid for (in time and money).

Our goal for NYC Startup Connectors is to create opportunities for entrepreneurs and other business professionals to connect in a more meaningful way. What do we mean by meaningful? Bringing people together for a defined purpose that aims to help you. Our events and activities focus on the art of connecting, rather than networking. (Quality over quantity). After all, establishing connections and building relationships shouldn't be about sales pitches or propositions, rather, what did you actually learn from the other person and how can you help them as well.

We will offer a variety of events throughout the year that primarily focus on the problems startups and entrepreneurs face. These experiences will involve local activities and tours that bring people together in different ways along with a few weekend escape trips that will get our connect our community outside the city.
results.name: NYC Startup Connectors

results.description: We are a group of performers that love throwing fun, unconventional meetups in NYC. No weirdos shoving business cards in your face here. It's a VIP experience, but we keep the vast majority of meetups free to attend, with drinks, etc. optional. results.description:
The Ridgewood Singers is an SATB mixed voice community chorus of about 50 singers in Ridgewood, NJ. These happy singers welcome newcomers and make you feel right at home. Some of them perform with other area choruses too.

Rehearsals are well-paced and stimulating. There are two rehearsal seasons: September to December, and January to May, with two concerts per year --- in May & December. Rehearsals are 7:30 to 9:30 p.m. on Monday evenings in a wonderfully accommodating rehearsal space in West Side Presbyterian Church at 6 South Monroe Street, Ridgewood. 

Membership dues are $55 per season. SATB scores are loaned to singers when dues are paid.

The group performs a wide variety of music and some artistically and musically challenging pieces too (great way to grow!). Professional music director and professional accompanist (see bios under PAGES). Singers are warmly invited to sample a rehearsal to see how they like us (no obligation). 

We look forward to meeting you and sharing the joy of singing with you! 

For information, please send a message to Linda D. and we can exchange info and chat if you like. 

PAGES: Click on the PAGES tab on top of the home page, to find our professionals' bios, concert attire, and more information about TRS. Thank you.

www.theridgewoodsingers.com
results.name: The Ridgewood Singers

results.description:
Want to make this the year when you finally start taking as good care of yourself, as you have everyone else in your life? Want to have more energy, improved health, and develop positive stress management skills, but the idea of joining a gym or going on yet another "doomed to failure" diet, are big turnoffs? Then this is the Meetup for you!!
Want to develop the physical, and emotional tools necessary to live functionally, and independently as you navigate the aging process? Then this is the Meetup for you!!
Through the combination of evidenced-based health and fitness exercises and information*, presented by a Certified Health Coach and Senior Fitness Specialist who will also facilitate group interaction and support, you can begin to make realistic and sustainable changes to your physical and psychological health!! * - As with any physical fitness activity, medical clearance is strongly recommended. As well as, informing the Health Coach of any pre-existing health concerns.

results.description: This is a group for New Yorkers who are looking for a more empowered, aware, and purposeful approach to life. Where your mind, heart, and body are all aligned for optimal performance and presence. Where we can gather together to share our passions with others. We don't strive for work/life balance as much as work/life integration because we believe work should be much more than just a paycheck. Most of us have tried living compartmentalized lives. You have your job, you have your friends, you have your personal beliefs, and for the most part you keep them separate because it's easier to manage that way. But eventually it gets tiring to try and keep all the plates spinning and the returns are diminishing. If you're looking for some more inspiration and purpose, come join us! We don't claim to have solutions. We believe, in the words of Joseph Campbell, that we're not really seeking the meaning of life, what we’re really seeking is "an experience of being alive." This group is for anyone who wants to be a part of exploring such experiences through finding fun, casual events throughout the city that can expand our consciousness and understanding of our own minds, emotions, and bodies.
results.name: NYC Integrate Your Life

results.description:
Members are interested in emergency communications using amateur (Ham) radio and are (or aspire to be) licensed by the FCC as Ham radio operators. This Meetup was formed to facilitate getting or upgrading a Ham radio license.

We also have a group of about 30 active Hams called ARCsquared. ARCsquared  stands for American Red Cross Amateur Radio Club. We are located at the Northern New Jersey headquarters of the New Jersey Region of the American Red Cross, and our "Base station", call sign NJ2RC, is located in the Disaster Operations Center ("DOC"). It is a project that was started in 2005 by ARC volunteers to improve the ARC's ability to communicate during disaster and emergency operations. It is not a corporation or other legal entity.  It is a group of hams interested in assisting The American Red Cross.  Hams are urged to become official Red Cross volunteers. 

For more information, the website is www.arcsquared.org.
results.name: NJ Ham Radio Group

topics.name: Tabletop Role Playing and Board Games

results.description:
This is a group for CCGs, RPGs, and Wargaming in Manhattan. This group meets every week and is administrated by a serious RPG and Wargaming expert.

Beginners are encouraged to join.  You can get free CCG, RPG, and Wargaming tutoring at any of our events.

Our events are located in Midtown Manhattan, Lower Manhattan, and in Queens.


_______________________________________________________________________________________________

A MESSAGE FROM ERIK

Hi.  My name is Erik.  Thank you for becoming a member of this group.  This should be a fun adventure.  I am going to be a Dungoen Master for this group.  I have spent many years as a mathematician and computer scientist specializing in Japanese and Indian mathematics.  I have also spent many years teaching religion in classes in Manhattan, New York and online through distance learning programs.  I have taught classes and given lectures on Norse Mythology, Polynesian Religion, East Asian Religion, and other religious and historical topics.  Currently, I am also a Kung Fu instructor in Manhattan's China Town and Manhattan's Korea Town.  I use my knowledge of religion, history, and mathematics in the campaigns that I produce and run.  I have very intelligent and unique perspectives towards role playing and have studied role playing games for over 20 years!  Please join me in the adventure of role playing games, CCGs, and table top games.   

_______________________________________________________________________________________________


The CCGs, RPGs, and Wargames! 

This is a list of all the CCGs, RPGs, and Wargames this group hosts.  If you do not see your favorite title on this list, send a message.  We can add other CCGs, RPGs, and Wargames on to the list as is necessary.

• Dungeons and Dragons (All versions)

• Magic The Gathering

• Netrunner

• Star Wars (All versions)

• Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (All versions)

• Ultimate Combat

• Warhammer (All versions)

 ________________________________________________________________________________________________________

How to register for campaigns and tournaments: 

CURRENTLY THERE IS NO COST FOR REGISTERING TO PLAY AN RGP OR TABLE TOP WAR IN THIS GROUP!

This group has 3 different styles of RPG, CCG, and Table Top sessions:

Campaigns

(Only 10 active registrations allowed per campaign!)

This is any storyline that is going to take more than 1 session to complete.  Typically campaigns are going to run until all of the player characters have either died or have finished the campaign objectives.

Flash Sessions

(Only 10 active registrations allowed per flash session!)

These are ideal for beginner players.  These are RPGs, CCGs, or Table Top sessions that are going to be completed the same day that they begin.

Tournaments

(Only 30 active registrations allowed per tournament!) 

Tournaments are going to be Campaigns and Sessions where players are ranked and a prize is going to be given to the winning players.


The current registration cost for Campaigns, Flash Sessions, and Tournaments is free.  You need to register any character, deck, or army with an official Manhattan RPG, CCG, and Table Top Dungeon Master though.  All characters need to be produced and rolled in front of an official group Dungeon Master.  All decks need to be checked and approved by a group Dungeon Master.   All armies need to be checked and approved by a group Dungeon Master.  This is to ensure that characters and stats are not altered and that characters are using their actual rolled stats and not illegally inflated stats.  When the group has more members than space to play, there is going to be a cost of $10.00 a character, $10.00 a deck, and $15.00 an army for registration.  Every group member gets to register 3 characters and 1 army for free.  You do not have to pay for sessions as long as you are using a registered character, or army, that has not died.  Characters can not be reused or reregistered after they die.  Armies and decks can be reused, but need to be reregistered and renamed, after they are defeated in battle. 

Usually, we are going to give at least 3 months notice prior to beginning any campaign.  You need to register for the campaign via meetup. If you are absent from a session during a campaign, you either are given a loss for that battle, or your character is said to be in a limbo and remains in place until you return.  If you do not return for 3 Meetups in a row, your character dies.  You are not allowed to reuse a dead character.


REGISTRION COST:

Characters:  FREE  (There is currently no cost for registering Characters with this group.)

Armies:  FREE (There is currently no cost for registering Armies with this group.)

Decks:  FREE (There is currently no cost for registering Decks with this group.)

_______________________________________________________________________________________________


Thank you,

Erik
results.name: The Manhattan RPG, CCG, and Table Top group!

results.description:
This is the Asian Computer Science and Mathematics Meetup.

This group uses the term Asian to refer to East Asian and South East Asian, not the culture and people of the Middle East.  When we speak of Asian Computer Science and Mathematics we are referring in large to the Computer Science and Mathematical information from China, India, Japan, and Korea.  We are also going to be studying Computer Science and Mathematics from other Asian nations such as; Lao, Mongolia, Nepal, Sri Lanka, and Vietnam.


This is a Meetup group that studies Asian Computer Science and Asian Mathematics. This is not a Meetup group only for Asians.  This is a Meetup group for people in New York who wish to study Asian Computer Science, and Asian Mathematics.  Many Americans use Greek Mathematics and European mathematics as the intellectual basis for their computer science and mathematics research and production.  This group uses Asian computer science and Asian mathematics as the basis for scientific research and production. 

Please join this group if you are interested in Asian Computer Science, Asian Mathematics, and networking with the Asian computer science and Asian mathematics community.

This is an excellent group to make friends with. The size of the membership is small and we encourage interaction among members.  You do not need to be a computer scientist or mathematician to join this group.  You can join this group for social purposes. 


The goals of this group are to:

• Encourage Asian Computer Science

• Encourage Asian Mathematics

• Enable Asian computer scientists and Asian mathematicians a venue for social networking.

• Research and produce knowledge bases of Asian computer science and Asian mathematical information.

• Exist as a group so Asian computer scientists and mathematicians can build successful computer science and mathematics careers.


This Meetup group is a virtual Meetup group.  At least 70% of our Meetups are going to occur in virtual space.  We are also going to be having Meetups in Manhattan, NY, and in Queens, NY.

The groups' Meetups are going to  include;

• Art Projects

• Café Discussions

• Dinner Discussions

• Holiday Events

• Lectures

• Online Meetings

• Online Projects

• Programming Projects


Please join us and become a member of the world of Asian computer science and Asian mathematics.

Thank you,
Erik
results.name: Asian Computer Science and Mathematics Meetup!

results.description:
This is the Midnight Computer Science and Digital Art Club.  The goal of this club is not to have a large Meetup with many people.  The goal is to have a functioning computer science club that has regular virtual meetings.  We are interested in people who are looking to explore alternative uses of computer science technology and who are interested in the social aspects of being a computer scientist or digital artist.

This group is designed to facilitate collaboration between midnight computer scientists and midnight digital artists.

WHAT IS A MIDNIGHT COMPUTER SCIENTIST?  WHAT IS A MIDNIGHT DIGITAL ARTIST?  If you are a computer scientist or Digital artist who spends more time on their computer at night than doing anything else, you probably qualify as a Midnight Computer Scientists or a Midnight Digital Artist.  This is a group that is dedicated to bringing together the scientists of the night to collaborate and design a digital future which is exceptional, artistic, and not necessarily only profitable, or ready for mass consumption.

 

THIS GROUP IS AN EXCELLENT WAY TO MAKE NEW FRIENDS AND SHARPEN YOUR COMPUTER SCIENCE SKILLS AT THE SAME TIME!

You do not need to be a computer science or mathematics professional to join this club.  Amateurs are encouraged to join.  You do not have to be technically inclined to join this club.  You can join for social purposes.

We would like programmers, mathematicians, and digital artists to join the club. We are going to be researching, studying and producing;


• Digital Audio

• Digital Graphics 

• Information Visualization

• Interface Design

• Operating System Design

• Programming Languages

• Virtual Reality


Thank you,
Erik
results.name: Midnight Computer Science and Digital Art Club!

results.description: More info to come soon, but I'll start with why I created this group and what it matters to me :) I’m passionate about positivity, inner health, and that we’re all gorgeous regardless of our unique weight, size, or appearance. I’ve always had fairly good self-esteem and confidence about my body and myself- and wanted the same for others. Of course we’re not going to feel great about ourselves 24/7, but I want to help more people feel happy, healthy, to love and accept themselves, and to realize how incredible they are. For a long time, I had a narrow view of what it meant to have positive body image- mostly dictated by what society said we should judge ourselves by: a specific beauty ideal, weight, what people thought, and by what we were eating. Throughout my personal evolution, I have learned to grow exponentially stronger in the love for my body and discovered this emerging body positive culture. What initially ignited my fire and determination to add to this important conversation about positive body image is the many women I started to meet post high school struggling with serious body image issues, and although I have not personally suffered, their experiences touched me greatly. What matters to me, and what I want to spread throughout my life- be it with the weights classes, Zumba classes, BollyX classes I teach or Meetups I run- is the importance of inner health -to prevent against disease etc- and that our weight and appearance does not determine our beauty nor worth. I'm clear that loving ourselves and our bodies is the best path to take- not negative self-talk or hate. I want to create a community where women can come and talk about a healthy body image and see themselves in a positive, loving light. Join me and let's talk about what it means for you! Love, health, and happiness, Sarah
results.name: NYC Body Positive- Love Yourself and Your Body at

self healing through forgiveness and love

results.description:
Hi Rye Goddesses!

Are you ready to Awaken Your Authentic Self? Women all over the world are waking up to a new renaissance of the heart, soul and body, reclaiming her inner voice and taking steps towards freedom.

For the last five years I have been repairing my relationship with my mental, emotional, physical and spiritual bodies. I overcame breast cancer and had to take a really hard look at all the emotional toxins and mindsetI was carrying around from my relationship with my parents and then men, I was acting out subconsciously, seeking love from a pain point. My wounds were speaking louder than my heart, they began to show me how unhappy I was. Fast forward five years to today. Today I travel and teach throughout North America sharing with women Soul Therapy Seminars and a Journey to Self Love, a two day emotionally empowering discovery of learning how to love yourself, honestly, courageously and with joy. I know you have been yearning to share with a group of women who have your back, seeking support from others who can understand your own journey, acknowledging your pain while uplifting you to greater new heights of self awareness. You've been ready for a long time now, searching and seeking your own journey to self love. I've been there, let me help guide you along the way so that you can get there with the support that you need to accelerate your life to one of freedom and inner peace. I am grateful to be able to share with you all that I have learned on my own journey to self love! 

Join me in this powerful group of women as we explore self love, while learning how to connect deeply to your authentic self, the part of you that is desiring to live a powerfully expressed life. There is that small voice that wants to be heard, understood, acknowledged and loved, that part is your authentic self: your soul.

Blessings,

Carolyn Goldfarb, Licensed Soul Therapist, Spiritual Healer & Guide

Testimonials:

*** I had the pleasure of taking Carolyn's "A Journey To Self Love" group class and it was amazing! She really gets to the heart of what is blocking you, which makes you see the light on where you have been struggling. Carolyn then provided me with suggestions that I could apply in a practical manner to shift out of my discomfort and struggle. She is very thorough and there is also group interaction and sharing which I really liked. She is an inspiration to all and her guidance has helped us see things in different and better way. I am going to sign up for one of her individual sessions as well. I highly recommend it! - Diane O. New York, NY I recently attended Carolyn's Journey to Self-Love workshop in New York City and had a very transcendent experience. She helped me to look inward at obstacles that have kept me from fully loving and forgiving myself. Carolyn has the innate ability to help people become more aware of their inner soul and how powerful they are as a human being. She also guides the group on how they can connect to their spirit guides which showed me how I am always supported and loved. She creates a space that allows you to feel empowered. - Tania E. Bloomfield NJ

*** I sought Carolyn's expertise to help me get past a "block" in my career. Although anxious about the experience, she took a great deal of time to help me understand exactly what was going to happen, how it works and everything in between. She also shared her own PLR experiences so that I felt more comfortable with the process.

Although it's hard to put into words, the experience was transformative and within less than 24 hours, I have a more open heart, mind and a new internal strength. Carolyn truly is a beautiful soul and is passionate about helping others to grow and be happy during this lifetime. If you are looking to understand yourself at a soul level to enjoy a better life, Carolyn can definitely help you get there. I know she hasn't seen the last of me.-Alexandra B., NYC

*** If you never met Carolyn, you should!!! Carolyn has an amazing approach to her work as a Soul Therapist and Past Life Regressionist.

Her approach allows you to discover information about yourself that has ultimately been a barrier to your self-growth. Carolyn allows you to identify these barriers in a very short amount of time that enables you to make changes that will facilitate action, personal satisfaction, inner peace and happiness that we are all seeking.

Carolyn cares deeply for others and has a gift for engaging you in conversation and connecting you with in a different level that allows you to make the change that you have always wanted to, but could not before. As good as it gets!!! :) - Danielle S.. Chicago
results.name: Soul Therapy for Women - Rye New York

results.description:
Rules for Joining this Group: 

• Must be able to read and write Hangul.

• Be able to introduce yourself in your target language. 배우는 언어로 자기소개를 할 수가 있어야 해요.

• Have a picture with your face visible. 프로필 사진에는 얼굴을 보여야 해요.

=====================================

This group is about structured speaking and listening practice. 말하기와 듣기도 연습 할수 있는 모임이에요.

The format is designed to spend an equal amount of time in English and Korean so that the learner can focus on speaking the language and get corrections from a native speaker. Part of the format is trying to say the same things in both languages and practice it many time with different partners. We think that this is a good way to practice both listening and speaking and have a chance to try to incorporate corrections given by each partner. 

=========================

Guidelines: 

• During each conversation try to focus on speaking 100% in that language. If your partner does not understand something or if you need to give an explanation then using the other language is OK. 각 5분씩 대화를 하면서 한가지 언어로 백퍼센트 이야기해 보세요. 상대방이 이해를 못 하면 설명 해주거나 다른 언어로 이야기해도 돼요.

• Try to help your partner by correcting grammar or telling them what is a more natural way to say something. 상대방이 한 말이 틀렸다면 고쳐주고, 뭐가 더 자연스러운지 상대방에게 알려주세요.

results.description:
Are you tired of dieting?  Do you eat when you’re NOT hungry?  Do you use food to comfort yourself?  If this sounds familiar, then you're in the right place.  I have developed the "Eating with a Happy Heart" Program  12 years ago in an effort to help people who use food for the wrong reasons, and who have spent lots of time, money and energy trying to heal this aspect of their life.  I have lived this program because I suffered for many years with this very issue, and so I look forward to sharing how I overcame this challenge. 

I will help you learn how to make peace with food and your body.  You will feel empowered by breaking the four negative eating behaviors.  This process will teach you how to release emotional eating and discover healthier techniques that will end your struggle with food, overeating and body image.  You will listen to your food cravings, and develop greater self-love and awareness in order to achieve wellness in your life.

This group will give you the opportunity to meet other like-minded individuals so that you do not have to feel alone with this issue.  You will feel the benefit from the connection and support of others.  

Each meeting will provide a lesson for discussion, followed by an open format for individual sharing among members.

We will meet bi-monthly on Saturdays for 1 -1/2 hours at American Bulldog Coffee Roasters located at 31 N. Broad St., Ridgewood, NJ.  There is a $30 pre-paid fee for each meeting.  Please bring writing materials with you.  Handouts will be provided as necessary.

For more information, please call me at 201-612-6700 or email robin@phoenixlifecoaching.net

You can visit my website at:  www.phoenixlifecoaching.net
results.name: Ridgewood Overcome Emotional Eating Meetup

results.description:
Welcome to the Orthodox Christian Study Group! The group gathers about once a month to study and talk about a Church inspired topics. The goal of the meetup is to expand our understanding of the Church teachings and at the same time build meaningful friendships with people of common interests. 

Group Guidelines:

The host of the meetup can select the topic, the location, and the study material. The sources used as study material can include Books, Papers, Lectures, Podcasts, Movies, etc, as long as it comes from a credible Orthodox source.  During the studying part of the meetup members ether read or the host gives a short presentation of the material that has been previously posted and shared with the group. If it involves a lecture such as a podcast or you-tube video, the material will be presented from a laptop. We can take turns and host and cover any topic such as Church Art, Science and the Church, Historic Events, Creation, Writings of Saints, etc, but from the perspective of the Orthodox Church. The study part will take place at a conducive to studying environment that will be posted in advance with all other related info at meetup website. A social gathering will follow at a cafe or restaurant during which open dialogue and socializing can take place. Besides Orthodox Christians, the group is open to non-Orthodox and those interested in Orthodoxy. Please sign up if you are interested in being an active member. God Bless!
results.name: Orthodox Christian Study Group

results.description: This group is for anyone who interested in eating out and trying new cuisine. The goal of this group is try different restaurant  ethnic cuisine and meeting new people and having great conversation. Usually it will be small group sizes to encourage conversation.

results.description: Do you have a startup idea but don't know how to get moving? We provide hands-on advice to help entrepreneurs establish a team as the first step in making concrete progress toward launching a business. Our events range from live in-person workshops to educational sessions to pitch evaluations to relaxed drinks and networking. When you’re becoming a founder, there’s a lot of advice about things that you’re not ready for. Plus, following a lean model means that you really don’t want to do the third thing first: instead, do the first thing, then the second thing, and so on. We’ve learned what’s critically important at this stage, and we lay it out for you. We want you to *actually* start your startup. Originate it with us.
results.name: Originate Your Startup!

results.description: I've come to realize that many schools that teach you research using SAS provide a lot of theoretical stuff that isn't really useful. Many Biostat courses in Academia give you clean data in a SPREADSHEET without any need to perform data manipulation. In reality, This is not the case in the REAL WORLD Research. After working in the Biostat field for about 10 years, I've combined common tasks I've seen over and over again that are critical for anyone interested in Research using the SAS software. For example, knowing how to merge correctly or what to do BEFORE a merge is a topic instructors often overlook. YOU JUST CAN'T GOOGLE THIS. After bouncing through multiple jobs from hospital to pharmaceuticals, I've combined everything in 9 SAS SESSIONS to give someone the skills to get into research or at least to get them to independently work on their own and use google. http://www.sas.com/en_us/software/university-edition/down... These sessions are also affordable. In part, because I was lucky to have a strong backing of resources and also because I REQUIRE students to bring in their laptops w/ SAS Installed (SAS offers free installation of education editions . I do have about 4 laptops with educational software installed. Course sessions start on 2/18/2016. Please see, www.BasicBiostats.com for more info.
results.name: Intro to Biostatistics and Epi using SAS in Healthcare

results.description: Do you think "outside-the-box?" Do you enjoy creating, exploring, thinking, and doing things beyond the usual crowd? All topics: from science to metaphysics, industrial to classical music, and anything in-between, are possibilities for discussion or activities. Let's make the effort to join together for exploration, collaboration, and just plain ol' socializing!

This means if you haven't attended, or shown interest in attending (aka putting your name on an event waiting list) an event in 3 months, you will be removed. Also, if you RSVP to an event and do not show up without letting me know, you'll be removed, simply on the basis that you took a spot from someone who would have attended. results.description:
Please read the rules below!

Naked in Motion is a collective of body-positive individuals with a mission to bring naked people together to move their bodies. We aim to celebrate the naked body, challenging the association of nudity with sex and shame. We are mindful of inclusivity, and our classes are open to all skill levels, body types, and genders. We even offer some sliding scale classes for people with varying income levels.

Buy tickets here

Naked in Motion Event Rules


Nudity is mandatory*

Physical contact: Before touching anyone, please ask for their consent. Naked hugs are great, but only if they are consensual. No tea means no tea.

Anonymity: If you meet someone at an event, and happen to interact with them in public, please be discreet about where you met. Even though “Naked! Yoga/Pilates” is a great name, we won’t be offended if you simply mention, “oh hey, we met at that yoga class, remember?”

Identity: Please do not presume the gender/sexual identity of those in the class, and be respectful of everyone’s identity.

The Erection Question: Whether they occur randomly or are sexually inspired, erections are almost always interpreted as the latter. If you get an erection during a group exercise, just ignore it. If you get an erection during social times before or after a class, please don a towel.

Cell Phones: Cell phones are strictly prohibited from our events while clothes are off. If you need to check your phone for any reason, please take it outside. Please turn your ringer/vibrator off during class. Stripped down? Phone down! Zero tolerance!

Bring a mat/towel: Please bring your own mat/towel, as we have a limited number of mats available to rent. If you do need to rent a mat, we ask that you bring a towel for sanitary reasons.

No jerks allowed: We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave at any time.


If you have any questions or complaints, please talk to your teacher(s).

Your privacy will be respected.


*if you want to cover something, please ask us before buying tickets to the event. We make exceptions for menstruating people and trans folk/others who might be struggling with body dysmorphia. Shyness is NOT a good excuse to wear clothing to a nudist event.
results.name: Naked in Motion

topics.name: Getting Unstuck and Out of Your Own Way!
Discover your Passion and Life Purpose

This is a group for anyone interested in exploring their passions and purpose, hearing from people who are leading purpose-driven lives, and tapping into their inner power. I started this group because I'm committed to empowering people to know their purpose and express it everyday with courage and creativity. Looking forward to having you as part of this community!

results.description:
New York Accredited Investors is a member led organization committed to helping entrepreneurs reach their full potential.

The New York Accredited Investors is comprised of over 50 active members.  Our members are entrepreneurs, CEO's, venture capitalists and business leaders who have founded, funded and built companies in the tech, real estate, retail, law, and health industry.  We come from a wide array of industry expertise and together create an extensive network of entrepreneurial support.

We mentor and coach the entrepreneurs in whom we invest, serve on their boards, provide contacts and assist with team building, strategic planning and fundraising.

Mission:
Our mission is to provide our members with great association and investment opportunities.

Investment Process:
We are not a fund and do not invest as a LLC.   Members collaborate in the due diligence process of opportunities presented but make individual investment decisions.

We’d like to invite you to review our site to learn how we can be a fit for your company. Should you decide to apply for funding through us, you’ll find the steps simple and straightforward.
results.name: New York Accredited Investors

results.description: Women who are looking to make new friends and have a good time. Do you feel like you're pass the going to clubs stage in your life but still would like to hang out with your girl friends on a Saturday night? If the answer is yes then this is the group for you! Whether your single, in a relationship, married, a mother this club is for you! There are plenty of fun things to do besides going clubing so that's why I'm starting this group. Most meets ups will be in NJ unless there's something really fun happening in NY. Please feel free to let me know if you have any ideas...Thanks in advance for joining.😊 NO SHOW POLICY: I understand that life gets busy and plans do change; however out of respect for me and other members please follow these rules... 1. If you plan to attend an event, RSVP "yes" 2. If your plans change, out of respect please change your RSVP to "no" at least 24 hours before the event (this is really important if there's a wait list, you could be giving someone else the chance to attend) 3. If you RSVP "yes" to an event, and do not attend, you are a "no show" 4. If you are a "no show" to three events in a calendar year, you will be removed from the group. I understand emergencies do happen so of course there can be some exceptions, all you have to do is reach out to me and let me know. Thanks Ladies

results.description:
1 Million Cups is a weekly, national program designed to educate, engage, and connect entrepreneurs with peers, mentors, educators and advisors. The 1MC concept is based on the notion that entrepreneurs discover solutions and network over a million cups of coffee. Developed by the Kauffman Foundation (bit.ly/1VnAWOi) in 2012, 1MC is a proven model which has quickly spread to 90+ cities around the country and has been featured in the New York Times, Fast Company, etc.

Each week, the 1MC program offers two local entrepreneurs an opportunity to present their startups to a diverse audience of mentors, advisors, and entrepreneurs. Presenters prepare a 6 minute educational presentation and engage in 20 minutes of feedback and questioning after they present. Entrepreneurs gain insight into possible ways they can improve their businesses, gather real-time feedback, connect with a community that truly cares about their progress, and walk away feeling like they have advanced their business. The audience also learns a great deal from the presentations. Whether this is through passively listening or deeply engaging with the entrepreneurs, there is much to learn every week from these dynamic and diverse communities.
results.name: 1 Million Cups NYC

results.description: It is hard when you are a young single mother that is trying to raise a strong, positive and independent child. Learn and practice salsa, bachata, rumba, chacha, samba, waltz, foxtrot, tango, hustle, and swing.

This group is for people looking to do amazing things in the podcasting world. Questions & Curiosity are Encouraged. Beginners, intermediate, & experts all welcome. 

Want to learn from the ground up? 

Need encouragement? 

Anyone who has an interest, passion, or desire to get a message out is ideally suited. (TBD)Initially, the group will meet online through Uberconference or Skype(Widely Used For Podcast) monthly then bi-weekly to allow faster progress. JOIN US for Opportunity, Entertainment, or Fun...

Anyone with an interest in the growing world of podcasting or internet radio.

Individuals that want to learn a new skill set or have an interest in the field of audio podcast production.

Anyone interested in promoting their business in the online digital world through the new communication medium of podcasting.

Individuals that are involved in the world of audio production.(Great Voice, Good at Sound Production, Knowledge of Podcasting Equipment, Any Contributing Skills Accepted, etc.,)

Curiosity seekers are also welcome(You never know???)

To create an Official NYC Podcasting Community that shares & supports one another in all phases of Podcasting. (What happens before, during & after the launch of your podcast)

To learn how to create a podcast from inception to end result.

To get your message out to the masses.

To grow together & create a force to bigger & better things in the Podcasting universe.

To build an audience to effectively market to for creating profits.

To explore what is possible & have realistic expectations for your podcast.

To meet new people that will help you get to new places & achieve new goals.

 ArJay the Digital Professor-Host of the Digital Wealth Digest Podcast

results.description:
LOFT Dining is a monthly social for the LGBT community who want to meet and make new friends and also enjoy an evening out that includes good food. All dinners will be a pre-fix type 3-course meal similar to restaurant week. We plan on a monthly varying schedule of weekdays and weekends. We will be dining at restaurants throughout Westchester, Rockland, and Putnam counties. In addition to socializing, we also seek to promote awareness of the LOFT, increase participation, and promote networking within the community. 

We meet on a monthly varying schedule of weekdays and weekends. Each member pays at the restaurant. The bill at the end of each meal is shared equally between those in attendance.  This avoids the awkwardness and time consuming activity of working out who had what. This should be no problem because the dinners will be pre-fix and all members will pay the same – except for extras and alcohol.  

We ask each diner for a $10 deposit to secure his/her place and this is taken off the final bill.
results.name: LOFT Dining

results.description: This is a group for women interested in discussion, salon-style, serious issues that affect women here in New York City, and around the world. We will discuss politics, city planning, education, health care and access, pay disparities, safety, girls' empowerment, media, books...anything we want! Of course, discussions always flow easier with a glass of wine or two, so there will be that too. I would love this group to be a safe space to share our ideas on how to make the world better for women to thrive, and to support each other as we work towards this vision. This group is open to anyone who identifies as a woman, and we do not subscribe to any particular philosophy or set of beliefs.

results.description: Do you have a pile of playbills hidden in your room? Hoard ticket stubs? Have playlists on your IPOD devoted to the likes of Kelli O'Hara and Sutton Foster? WELL MY FRIENDS ... YOU ARE NOT ALONE. Welcome ! Meet your people! The theater people. The Broadway Badasses. We spend most of our disposable income on the arts and love to brag about the shows we've seen. We can throw random musical lyrics into any conversation. We WILL wait for 3 hours in the freezing cold for rush tickets to The Color Purple. We say things like "Well... I could pay $35 for a cab to the airport... BUT THAT's A THEATER TICKET. SO I'll SUBWAY IT." We stage door it. We're Devoted. This group is for the theater fans out there that want to meet other Broadway Badasses. I created this group because I just moved here and need to meet some of my people! JOIN! LET'S BE FRIENDS! We can go see a show and talk about it after! We can debate for hours how Kelli O'Hara should have won a Tony for The Bridges of Madison County. We can go for coffee and cry when our favorite show closes early!

results.description:
Thank you for your interest in our meet-up, and we look forward to not only getting to know you -- but understanding what is your "Why”. Why do you want to make a difference? And, what are you willing to contribute to make that difference happen?

All too often, people talk about problems, but then do nothing themselves to help make the situation better. Others, want to get involved in something meaningful, but find their choices limited to handing out food at a soup kitchen or food bank ... while others just walk a few miles once a year.

While all these things are helpful, ask yourself are these questions ...

• Are the activities you are doing really significant?

• If you didn't do it, would it still get done?

• Are you unintentionally discriminating against others in what you're doing?

• Are you really impacting the lives of others in a meaningful, long-lasting way?

• Are you able to continuing build on what you're doing to have greater and greater impact?

• Are you activity affecting your community?

• Are you working on positive change for your country?

Our social activism club doesn’t discriminate in membership acceptance. We accept people from all different backgrounds, ages, educational levels, income, religion, gender, country of origin. 

There are only three things you have to have in order to be successful in our organization:  

(1) Desire 

(2) Determination

(3) Coachability/Team Player

So join us and work on these amazing programs:

• Help Petition President Obama to Declare August “National Kids Month”  

• PSA, Television, Video, Print & Social Media Programs -- Pre, Post & Production

• Books, Blogs, Articles -- From Writing to Design To Publishing & Marketing

• Youth & Adult Educational Programs  

• Social Responsibility School & Community Clubs  

• Community Learn & Earn Programs  

• Special Event Marketing, PR, Coordination, Management  

• Fundraising, Grants, Sponsorships & Partnerships  Much Much More! 


So, regardless of your educational or work background -- join us and make a difference!
results.name: NYC Social Responsibility Movers & Shakers Activist Club
