Our different team members invest in Commercial or Residential Properties, Multifamily/Apartment Buildings, Tax Liens/Deeds, Owner Financing, Lease Options (Rent to Own), Fix & Flip/Rehab, Short Sales, Pre-Foreclosures/Foreclosures, and REO’s, Wholesaling;

Our group is a fun-filled way to gain information on a variety of up to date real estate topics: 

• Creative Investing Strategies and Tips; 

• Finding Off-Market Properties and Buyers; 

• Loans and Private Funding; 

• Real Estate Tax & Legal Strategies;

• Deal Analysis; 

• Understanding Your Marketplace;

• Market Updates; 

• And Much More...... 

We welcome both new and seasoned investors/professionals and anyone that is open-minded and constantly looking to expand their own abilities and knowledge base. We don't teach Real Estate Investing per se, we create Real Estate Investors. Working with us will allow you to earn while you learn real estate investing. Thanks to our teamwork we've been able to help some members make their dream work by "Firing Their Boss." 

The ultimate goal of the group is to help investors grow to the next level, while providing information and tools that can be used in the field today. I know you've heard of the saying "It's lonely at the top." That's a phrase that we're helping to change.

results.description:
Welcome to the FASHIONISTAS in Business Meetup! I'm so excited that you're interested in taking part in this wonderful, up-and-coming community of like-minded women who are passionate about fashion and determined to build successful businesses doing what they love—Fashion!

As a swimwear designer, I felt very secluded and lonely working on my business. It wasn’t until I started my Coaching Certification, where I met other like-minded ladies, that I noticed my business starting to improve! 

It made me realize how important it is to have a community of peers who are doing the same thing as you. Not only sharing ideas and strategies to grow your business, but also to have a place to go when things don’t go as expected and you need a little inspiration or cheering up!

That’s why I created my VIP Facebook Group, because nothing compares to real-time support and live discussions with entrepreneurs who have been in your shoes.  

And you can join now: https://www.facebook.com/groups/MarketingforFashionistas/

However, for the lucky ones who live in NY, I decided to create a Monthly Meetup since nothing compares the face to face interaction!!!

My Meetups won't be just to make connections (which I know how important it is to your success) but also a bit of Training! 

Yes, FREE Training from moi! Each month we'll meet to talk about a specific topic that will help you move closer to your Dream Fashion Biz! If that does not blow up your socks down, I don't know what will :-)

Examples of topics to be covered include:

- Facebook Ads to Boost Sales of Your Products or Services

- How to Create Raving Fans for Your Brand

- My 5 Secrets to Earn $5K - $10K Consistently

And much, much more!


This group will be a place where you can get the support and help you need to succeed!

When you do join, please take the time to introduce yourself, and tell us a little bit about your Fashion Biz!

The only rule... You must be a Fashion Entrepreneur: Fashion retailers, boutique owners, fashion designers, jewelry designers, stylists, etc.

Also, do keep in mind that this is a fun, friendly and supportive group, so we need to keep it that way :)  

If you need more support, please email me at agustina@marketingforfashionistas.com

Enjoy, and get involved!

Agustina xx
results.name: FASHIONISTAS in Business

results.description: Talk & discussion: With the publication of Job, Joseph Roth's 1930 novel about a Galician Jewish family forced to immigrate to New York, Roth's literary reputation skyrocketed. His novel The Radetzky March, which appeared two years later, is almost universally recognized as a classic. Yet Roth’s earlier work, in which he probingly examined the upheavals of his time—particularly the Russian revolution—have only recently been rediscovered. In the United States, a new anthology of his early reportage, The Hotel Years, has just been published by New Directions, and in Germany his newly published essays on Russia have been celebrated by critics and readers alike. Are we experiencing an international Roth Renaissance? Jan Bürger and George Prochnik will discuss one of the most important and enigmatic writers of the modern era, and provide insights into his astonishing body of work with the aid of manuscripts and letters from the Leo Baeck Institute, New York, and the German Literature Archive, Marbach. Jan Bürger is a literary scholar and author. He wrote his dissertation about Hans Henny Jahnn, belongs to the founding editors of the Berlin journal Literaturen, and has worked since 2002 at the German Literature Archive. In addition to numerous contributions to journals and newspapers (including Die Zeit and the Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, he has written Der gestrandete Wal: Das maßlose Leben des Hans Henny Jahnn (2003), Benns Doppelleben oder wie man sich selbst zusammensetzt (2006), Max Frisch: Das Tagebuch (2011) and Der Neckar: Eine literarische Reise (2013). He is also the editor of a number of events including Ich bin nicht innerlich. Annäherungen an Gottfried Benn (2003), Friedrich Schiller: Dichter, Denker, Vor- und Gegenbild (2007), Liebe ist Quatsch. Briefe an Ellinor by Hans Henny Jahnn (with Sandra Hiemer, 2014) Briefwechsel by Alfred Andersch and Max Frisch (2014), as well as Reisen in die Ukraine und nach Russland by Joseph Roth (2015). George Prochnik has written for the The New York Times, The New Yorker, Bookforum and the LA Review of Books. His most recent book The Impossible Exile: Stefan Zweig at the End of the World received the National Jewish Book Award for Biography/Memoir in 2014. He is editor-at-large for Cabinet magazine. Photographs reproduced thanks to the generosity of the Leo Baeck Institute. Details Language: English Price: Free admission +1 212 4398700 info@newyork.goethe.org 01/13/16 6:30pm Goethe-Institut New York 30 Irving Place New York, NY 10003
results.name: The Unmendable Self: New Perspectives on Joseph Roth

results.description: Hey Guys, T21 Rocks! was created by the parents of two rocking little girls, Samantha and Marilyn. Who were born on the same day with a little extra chromosome - Down Syndrome. Their mommas -Iris and Larissa- craved a community in which they could feel accepted, united, and supported. Sammy's dad - Jamie - longed for a network of strong fathers dedicated to their families and the advancement of their children. The T21 Rocks! family wants to be there to show the world what all individuals with Trisomy 21 are capable of - beginning with their families. We are based out of NYC, and all of our events are located around the city. We want to let other families know they are not alone on their journey. We support each other and provide advice, strength, and resources where necessary. We encourage parents and family members along, and we will be there to help celebrate your loved ones as they achieve their goals and dreams! Our children have no limits, they can do and be whatever they want because, T21 ROCKS!!
results.name: T21 ROCKS! Down Syndrome Meetup Support Group

ETC

results.description: We are visionary or global parents, perhaps bi-racial, or multi-ethnic, perhaps with multi-cultural children.  What we have in common is our belief that one of the best gifts we can give our children is the gift of duo or multilingualism.  But its not as easy as it seems.  Especially when only one parent speaks a second language; or neither parent does; or our child is insisting upon English; or there are no immersion programs nearby or affordable, or our child already has too much on his/her plate.  Our group explores what works and doesn't work.  When is the best time and age to introduce another language, and what are the best approaches parents and educators can use.  We explore all possibilities, from moving abroad, to hiring a Nanny, to enrolling in an immersion school or Saturday classes, to homeschooling, and more.   We have discussions, playdates, movie nights, and story times.  We are unrelenting and determined to give the gift of language!
results.name: Parents Trying to Create Multilingual Kids in NYC

results.description:
Finally they confirmed my diagnosis of metastatic cancer; which I have always known but secretly hope that I might be wrong..... Now what? Well, there are admirable heroes who can handle cancer diagnoses with grace and compassion; not for themselves solely but mostly for the sake of people around them. They are my idols but I knew from the get-go that I am absolutely not yet one of them. I want to scream, throw a tantrum, kicking up like a baby while whining and sobbing and swearing on the floor. I don't act like this all the time though because it requires a bit physical strength. Never less, I believe that we, the ordinary people, have the right to react to cancer however we wish to, and those superheroes need a break every now and then too. So I started this group with one goal in mind- for my fellow cancer carriers to be openly emotional, freely expressional, and swear at cancer until we exhausted all dirty words we know, then we go shopping and eating and dancing like no tomorrow. And then, we gather ourselves and get on with our ordinary life and live as healthy as one can be, until the next meetup. :) 


Yup, our menu includes screaming exercise (a.k.a Friday night dance club), anger management (a.k.a boxing with the cute gym coach), stress release exercise (a.k.a swearing phrase spelling bee, crying competition), group field trips (e.g. reiki, craniosacral therapy, princess spa, hair shedding shower, wig fitting party), and world peace, seriously (a.k.a trips around the USA and the world to drag our fellow cancer carriers out of their shells or their superhero masks, and share a lot of FUN and SHIT dealing with cancer! Or anything you disparately need a group support, just holler!
results.name: I've Got Cancer, LOL- NYC

Our goal is to highlight the breadth of talent in the tech industry and discuss its importance. Topics will include, but are not limited to, starting out and staying in tech, career tips, knowledge sharing, and what we can do to advocate for inclusiveness in the workplace. 

The lack of diversity in tech has been a part of the national conversation in recent years, and while it would be great to start a group that will solve this issue, we have humbler ambitions. Our mission is to create a place where people can build meaningful relationships and empower each other by fostering a community where education, inclusiveness, and empathy are paramount.

Our aim is to bring people from all backgrounds and seniority levels together to form lasting connections in the tech industry. We welcome mentors and mentees to share and discover resources to develop the skills required to start or advance their career.

results.description:
Hi, I’m Wendy Hung. I’m a transitional coach and transforming lives is my passion. I've moved more than 20 times in my lifetime, have worked with fortunate 500, SMEs, am currently an entrepreneur and a mother of a beautiful daughter after a scare with ovarian cancer that led me to believe that miracle and magic do exist. In other words, CHANGES is my best friend.

Over the last couple of years, I've been involved in the transformation of others' lives through Accomplishment Coaching and Landmark. I created '2nd Chance, 2nd Life' because I believe we deserve a 2nd chance to live the life that we love.

I'm here to support people to embrace major changes in their lives (e.g. cancer, relocation, career changing, starting a business) and to empower their choice (or the lack of it). We will have activities that will generate light, love, connection and strength, together. You will create and experience the connection and love with self, others and our lives, with power, by design. 

Come out and join us at our next 2nd Chance, 2nd Life event. We attract a wonderful and inspiring group of people. I look forward to connecting with you!

Warm Regards,

Wendy Hung
results.name: NY/NJ Cancer Survivors - 2nd Chance, 2nd Life

results.description:
We started our first meetup group in San Francisco back in March 2012.  It now has over 7,500 members (15,000 in all the Bay Area).  With the success of our events, we're now expanding to the New York, NY!

Our goal is to provide a fun low-pressure environment/activity where individuals can connect one-on-one. Sometimes it's intimidating to go to a group activity all by yourself. Or sometimes you get lost in a big group event – you talk to everyone but get to know no one. Wouldn't it be nice to have a date at a fun event?

With our activities, you're welcome to come alone or with a date. And if you need a date, visit HowAboutADate.com. (1) post a date - what, when, & where, (2) review replies, (3) choose your date and go out. Dating Simplified! Do what you love... and love will find you.

Yes, this is a different Meetup group – it combines great activities with (optionally) bringing a date for that activity. We simply want you to have a great time (i.e. enjoy fun dates not "interview dates" or high pressure dates). And feel free to suggest great "first date" activities and even post links to other great meetup events. We're not here to compete with other meetups, only to support and enrich the Singles Community!

There is no age requirement for our group, except that you're over 18 of course. Our members range from 20 to 70 y.o. We're all about making friends first and enjoying the company of others and doing wonderful activities throughout New York and the surrounding areas. Cool couples are welcome to attend our great events as well. 

Cheers!
results.name: HowAboutADate - New York

This crew’s core focus is on the rapidly emerging technologies and creative concepts specifically suited for the immersive and augmented mediums.

We invite all those enthusiastic about these technologies and hope to uncover ways for those with various perspectives to contribute to the rapidly emerging immersive and augmented movement. 

We envision a constructive forum for 360 immersive video production pros, designers, virtual reality pioneers and programmers as well as experiential brand managers, behavioral scientists, performance artists, educators, and social do-gooders to find group sessions rewarding on many different levels.  We feel this medium can unite those with different skill sets in a way that fosters meaningful experiences.

Please share your suggestions: thinkimmersive@gmail.com.

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in prototyping user experiences for Mobile, Desktop, Wearables and beyond! I started this group to meet other prototyping enthusiasts and learn from each other.

Prototyping is something that can be useful to different people from UX/UI Designers to Product Designers, from Product Managers to Entrepreneurs – and in general to anyone that wants to communicate an idea for a product, service or feature. All skills levels are welcome. Looking forward to meeting everyone!

This group topics:

• What should you prototype and with what tools? Article I wrote on the right tools here

• Discuss why it's good to prototype early and often 

• Overview the panorama of prototyping tools out there like the ones listed here

• Share favorite prototyping tools and techniques (Like InVision or Marvel, Pixate, Principle for Mac...)

• Best ways to create assets for prototype? Pros and cons of using Photoshop, Illustrator vs Sketch App

• Share prototypes and get feedback

• Advanced Prototyping: Using front end coding technologies HTML, JS, or backend (Rails, etc)

• Beyond visual prototypes: using SMS interfaces? Audio? VR? Position based interfaces? 


Feel free to suggest additional topics! :)

Francesco


PS: Depending on the group interests we might schedule workshops too.
results.name: Prototyping User Experiences NYC Meetup

I LOVE my little guy, but I've definitely learned how important it is to get out and enjoy some social time to be a strong mommy. results.description: In June 2015 I assumed the role as US Director for the Israel Venture Network, an innovative venture philanthropy/impact investing organization focused on strengthening social businesses in Israel that provide employment & career advancement opportunities to the country's most vulnerable populations. We manage four social business investment funds and are currently incubating 30+ portfolio companies. This group is for professionals and philanthropists who are find themselves at the intersection of business & philanthropy, looking for opportunities to leverage their investment and business skills for social change in Israel. I wanted to be sure to personally invite and encourage members of this group to attend our upcoming IVN Yozma Fund Launch event on January 27 from 5:30-7:30pm at a very cool social business here in NYC (Colors Restaurant.) We will be celebrating the launch of our ground-breaking social investment fund - created in partnership with the Israeli government, philanthropy & business - and will be featuring expert speakers to talk more about social impact investing and the growing social business ecosystem. The Fund’s Social Mission is to create an opportunity for sustainable social change by investing in and mentoring social businesses that focus on vocational training and employment for: Youth-at- risk, People with special needs, Recovering addicts, Released convicts, Chronically unemployed, Elderly, and Single parents. The invitation can be viewed here: http://us12.campaign-archive2.com/?u=469cc2d80f2cd1713a799cb15&id=a7f9a36678 Included on the invite is the link to RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/celebrate-the-launch-of-the-ivn-yozma-fund-tickets-20406209522
results.name: Impact Investing in Israel for Social Change

That’s how industries as diverse as healthcare, retail, banking and travel are using Watson to reshape their industries. In a sense, Watson can think. When Watson thinks with you, you can outthink the limits of what’s possible. Want to innovate and/or start the next disruptive new business, then join us at our meetups to learn how Watson can drive your startup or established company forward in the era of cognitive business.

Progressive learning means that each class teaches you new steps/technique, and turns while at the same time previewing what you learned in previous classes. this way you will never fall behind. You will learn step by step with plenty of practice and repetition in a no-rush environment. There are people who learn by watching while others learn by understanding what they see. We will teach you in both ways. We demonstrate, repeat, and practice all the steps while at the same time explaining what you are learning in details. Join us and you will be dancing salsa in a competent way in no time.

Hello! 

If you are a business owner in the Bellmore, NY area and are looking to grow your business, as well as increase your network of businesses that you can trust and rely on look no further than Simply Referrals! 

Simply Referrals is the type of business networking group that is all about developing long-lasting relationships, as opposed to contracts, and membership fees and ultimatums that other groups have. S.R. has no contracts, no fees, and no nonsense. 

Simply Referrals is also an exclusive membership, which means you will be the only one from your respective profession. 

S.R. is a true network of business professionals that you can trust. Our #1 goal is to develop a team of businesses that not only its members can trust to refer and work with, but a team of businesses that can be counted on by local businesses, family, and friends to always act in good faith, and always do the right thing. If Simply Referrals sounds like a business networking group that you would like to be a part of, please see us at our next meeting! Regular meetings are approximately every 3 weeks, and held Wednesday mornings at 7:00 a.m. If you have any questions please email or call at 516-314-1691.

Steven Bellafiore

We all want to be seen, to be heard, and to have a place to go to that allows us liberation from the responsibilities we've signed up for in our daily lives. Female friendships are a hope to our sisterhood, and they serve as the catalyst to a more wholesome, fulfilled, joyous life. This is an opportunity for high-caliber women to impact each other's lives and to remind each other that we are not alone on this life-path.

results.description:
If you are looking for freedom, in your job, in your finances, or in your relationship, then you are in the right place! 

Freedom doesn't come from the external world, it can only come from inside you. This is a group for courageous people who are ready to look within, realize who they really are, and start living a life they desire with more inner freedom and joy. 

I'm Mandy, I'm a certified intuition coach, and my mission is to help people know themselves and live the life they want. In this group, we will have regular gatherings in the form of free classes, paid workshops, coaching groups, exploration circles, and healing sessions. 

Topics will include, but are not limited to the following. And these are general ideas, each meeting will have more details about the specific topic: 

• Happiness: Why money can't buy it? How to get more of it? 

• Freedom: What is it? What are we chasing? How can we really get it?

• Love: What is love beyond romantic love? What are we really looking for? Why we would die for it? 

• Emotions: What's the truth hidden behind them? How do we judge emotions? How do we use emotions? What do emotions take away from us? 

• Healing: What is healing? Why do we refuse to heal? What are we gaining by not healing? And what are we giving? 

Looking forward to sharing our exciting journeys together. To find more information about me, check out my website: http://whexp.com
results.name: Live the Life You Love NYC

As those looking to dive, lovers of the ocean or those qualified divers there are ample opportunities to get out and touch our oceans. 

Working with groups out in Florida, St. Croix and worldwide there are opportunities to get out and learn to dive or just dive again right here in New York! We are on a mission to increase awareness of our ever changing oceans. Come join us in this call to action to help save our ocean friends.

results.description:
Does speaking in front of a group sends a chill down your spine?  Do you feel the butterfly flutter in your stomach everytime you get up to speak in front of your peers?  You are not alone. In fact, Glossophobia or the fear of public speaking is the number one fear for most people.  Do you want to know what is the number two fear? It is fear of death. That's right. More people are afraid to speak in public than that are afraid to die!  Fortunately there is help.

Toastmasters International is a non-profit educational institution primarily focused on helping aspiring leaders communicate effectively. Its award-winning program has helped thousands of members across the globe improve on their speaking skills for the last 90 years. 

Art of Speaking was founded in 2002 as a Toastmasters club and has been instrumental in mentoring hundreds of confident speakers.  Membership in Toastmasters club is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. At a cost that is little more than a Pumpkin Spice Latte a month, it is also one of the most cost-effective skill-building tools available anywhere. Visit one of our meetings to understand the program and its benefits. There is no charge to attend as a guest.
results.name: Art of Speaking Toastmasters Club - North Edison

Looking forward to learning with you! 

Yehudi 

Yehudi Meshchaninov is the founder of Leadership Labs NY (LLNY), a consulting firm dedicated to helping leaders build engaging and productive teams. His focus includes leadership development, group-dynamics, and organizational agility. Prior to founding LLNY, Yehudi served as Director of Leadership Development for The New American Initiative, an educational reform organization. Yehudi is an AMA certified MBTI coach, conflict mediator, lecturer at Yeshiva University's Office of School Partnerships leadership program, and a doctoral student at Columbia University. By creating a time and place to meet weekly, we can support, share and learn from one another. We will meet on Wednesday evenings for a guided meditation, followed by a group discussion. Focus will be on the Buddhist mindfulness tradition, however all are welcome - new or experienced meditators from any tradition who endeavor to develop a meaningful practice.

* You don't need to belong to this (or any) church to attend this Meetup. Our group is an independent meditation group.

No charge, but dana (a suggested $10 donation) will be gratefully accepted.

* We also have another Meetup group called MONDO Morning Mindfulness Meditation, specifically for our Friday morning meditation class at MONDO (426 Springfield Ave in Summit, 3rd floor), taught by longtime meditation teacher, Kerry Rasp, on (most) Friday mornings from 10:30-11:30am. results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested to "Think and Grow Rich".

Welcome everyone who would like to THINK and Grow Rich!
I would like to invite you to join us for a Webinar series (free and no obligations). We will have our meetings in webinar format on a weekly basis and will read and study one of most readable book in human history "Think and Grow Rich" written by Napoleon Hill. Napoleon Hill dedicated 25 years to writing this book and finding out the keys to success.
The object of these Webinars and this book is to help all those who seek success, to learn the art of changing their minds from failure consciousness to success consciousness.
Napoleon Hill: “When you begin to think and grow rich, you will observe that riches begin with a state of mind, with definiteness of purpose, with little or no hard work. You, and every other person, ought to be interested in knowing how to acquire that state of mind which will attract riches. I spent twenty-five years in research, analyzing more than 25,000 people, because I, too, wanted to know “how wealthy men become that way.” 
Consulting Engineer and long-time associate of Thomas A. Edison, said— “This is not a novel. It is a textbook on individual achievement that came directly from the experiences of hundreds of America’s most successful men. It should be studied, digested, and meditated upon. No more than one chapter should be read in a single night. The reader should underline the sentences which impress him most. Later, he should go back to these marked lines and read them again. A real student will not merely read this book, he will absorb its contents and make them his own.”
results.name: Brooklyn Book Club Meetup Think and Grow Rich

How to be an Artist is an one night workshop by a working artist for actors, performers, artists, musicians and writers. We will cover:  How to make a Living as an Artist. Overcoming the myth of the Starving Artist. Finding your character. Tapping the Unconscious for Creativity and Originality. How to deal with other people heckling you, including your family, friends, peers, critics and even yourself. How to weather the emotional storms of being an artist. How to balance your art and your day job. Master Lee has performed on Sesame Street and Riker’s Island. He is a native New Yorker, legendary street performer and comic. He has written and produced two plays. He has taught Tai-chi & Chi Kung for over 30 years as well as Performance Studies at NYU. He has won two MothSlams. He is writing a book entitled, How to be an artist and not lose your mind. 

This event is free. 

Email him at masterleelovesyou@gmail.com to reserve a spot.

results.description:
Mademoiselle Yvonne Combe founded the French School of Music in Plainfield, NJ in 1927. She was a child prodigy at the Paris Conservatory who worked with four famous French composers: Claude Debussy, Camille Saint-Saëns, Gabriel Fauré, and Maurice Ravel (we have information in the French School archives to validate this). 

Mlle. Combe won first place in a competition in the Paris Conservatory at age 13. When she played for Debussy, he conceded her interpretation of one of his pieces improved it so much that he instructed his publisher to make certain changes to his printed work in the next printing. She performed Saint-Saëns' second concerto with Saint-Saëns conducting the orchestra, at age 15 in 1907. That same year, though, she fractured her wrist in a bike accident. Because it was improperly set, she had to give up her budding career as a solo concert pianist and turned to teaching, setting up her first school in Switzerland. It was Sergey Rachmaninov who advocated to the US State Department that she be allowed to emigrate to the US to bring solfege to this country.

Through Claude Debussy, the lineage of musicality continues up through Franz Liszt, Carl Czerny, and Ludwig van Beethoven (you can Google this in the Wikipedia pages). So former students of Mlle. Combe and her students (including Stephen Waters and more) are musical descendants of these famous composers. 

I was Mlle. Combe's piano student from 1972 - 1982 and performed at Carnegie Recital Hall nine times as a child. My little sister performed there ten times, and many of my classmates did as well. Alumni during the 1970s who went professional musically have worked with Zubin Mehta and Constance Keene, studied at Juilliard (seven classmates that I know of including myself) and other conservatories (five that I know of), and become worldwide concertizing artists, professors at conservatories, resident composers and artists. One alumna after my time is now a professional singer who has sung in many famous movies.

Those alumni during my time who did not become professional musicians became doctors, lawyers, technologists (like myself), entrepreneurs, executives, educators, etc. Some crossed over, becoming professional performers and entrepreneurs / technologists. It turns out we didn't just learn about music. We learned about discipline, self-control, attention to detail, perseverance, standards of excellence, and how to pick ourselves up and continue on when we ran into challenges. These are universally valuable skills that affect every aspect of one's life - personally and professionally.

Sounds intimidating, doesn't it? Here's the thing: were we a bunch of freaky Mozart genius kids? 

Oh heck no. 

What happened was that we were given wildly efficient and effective piano practice methods, solfege lessons to develop our understanding of music, and insights from a teacher who knew exactly what the French composers intended with their compositions. 

Those of us who are part of the French School of Music family were given an extraordinary opportunity, and we fully intend to pass along what we learned from Mlle. Combe. Our mission is to ensure that future generations of music students have the same opportunity that we had, including adding their names to an amazing musical lineage. 

We welcome all who are passionate about music, who want to learn better piano practice techniques, and learn how solfege can help you build a solid musical foundation. 

- Eileen Chang Sauer

French School of Music
210 W 8th Street
Plainfield, NJ 

(908) 757-3087
info@frenchschoolofmusic.com


Resources:

French School website

French School Facebook page, which includes historical artifacts and photos from French School, recordings of recitals, as well as video of Carnegie Recital Hall performances and trophy ceremonies in the 1970s.

My dad's piano practice book, capturing Mlle. Combe's teaching techniques from the perspective of a parent who attended some of our piano lessons and recorded French School recitals.
results.name: Plainfield French School of Music Meetup

We plan to hold one book discussion and one movie discussion meeting per month, both combined with updates on local volunteer / activist opportunities. 

Movie nights - Focus on enjoying the film, some discussion and enjoying getting to know each other.

Book / Topic Discussion - The discussion will focus on a topic, as prompted by the book.  Please don't feel you have to read the entire book!  Read a couple of reviews, read the first chapter, read media pieces about the book..  just be prepared to discuss and be open-minded about the topic.  I know it's hard to find time to read in our busy lives.. but take some time here to discuss and learn.  

It is our mission to support the following: - economic justice - environmental justice - immigrant justice - LGBTQ justice - racial justice - reproductive justice - voting rights Join us to discuss, to educate, and be educated. Last year Members of BNI passed thousands of referrals, which generated over 4$ Billion dollars worth of business for each other! Would you like to increase your business by 20%, 30%, 50% or as much as 100%? You can see results like this! Many have. Some participants have added as many as 50 new clients in the first 2 years!!! We will have fun together, give back to the community as well as strategize how we can get to the next level in life personally and professionally. results.description: Data Driven New Jersey is a community of people who are 'working with' or 'interested in' Data. This is a cross-channel and industry/vendor agnostic group designed to foster relationships and bring like-minded people together to further progress around the capabilities of data. Understanding and managing data is now a vital part of successful organizations. Share insight, challenges and experiences with others in your field. Regardless of your experience, join the group for networking and an exploration of every aspect of data. At least once a quarter the group meets to discuss trends, view presentations and network with fellow data professionals and enthusiasts.

topics.name: Getting Unstuck and Out of Your Own Way!

results.description: Do you feel lost? Overwhelmed? Unfulfilled? Do you feel stuck or Ineffective? Does your life never seem to match up with your hopes and dreams? If so, have you ever considered why? When we are born, we are not given a Manual on how life works. Instead we are largely left to figure things out on our own or adopt what others say or do. What we often end up with are ineffective ways of responding to life that actually increase the frustration and dissatisfaction we experience. What we all need is a manual that will provide us with a comprehensive perspective on life as well as a practical methodology to increase our awareness, understanding and ability to respond more effectively to life's challenges. If you have been searching for such a manual, your search is over. As a community we help people decrease stress, improve health and increase effectiveness using a unique philosophy, The Manual 4 Life
results.name: The Manual 4 Life Meetup

results.description: join Us in the Gowanus section of Brooklyn for a 3D printing meetup hosted by formlabs 3D. Come learn tips and tricks to get the most out of your 3D print. Before and after a presentation and Q and A there will be time to network with other 3d modeling professionals. We'll have snack and drinks.

results.description: This is a group for people who love to watch foreign films and vintage independent english language films. I intend to feature films of African and Black Diaspora; Arabic, Iranian and Turkish Cinema; European Cinema; Japanese and Chinese Cinema; India, Pakistan and Bengali Cinema; Latin and Brazilian Cinema; and Vintage and Indie films from the USA, UK and Australia.

results.description: Temple Israel is a place where community happens. Take a peek at one of my classes! http://youtu.be/ftGxBvm4Xbs

topics.name: Power Animals and other Spirit Guides

results.description:
Spirit animal Karaoke is a phrase that doesn't have any meaning, save whatever it is that you feel when you encounter it. and that's what it's for; it's something simple and mysterious meant to scale the wall of your intellect and tug lovingly at something beyond what you can define. It's been shared with me in some capacity and I share it freely with you, whoever you are. And if you want to join this group only just becasue you like the sound of those words together, that to me is just fine.

Spirit Animal Karaoke is also the name of an event -- free, ostensibly one-off -- scheduled for March 21 at 7:30 PM. The process by which this event's participants, audience and content are being generated in improvisational and intuitive. This meetup group exists because of this process. And I invite you, if you're interested, to involve yourself in some capacity with this process.
results.name: Spirit Animal Karaoke

results.description: Finally, the Meetup you professionals West of the Hudson River have been waiting for! This group is for chill outgoing positive people living in Jersey City, Hoboken and the surrounding area who like to network and enjoy themselves some Happy Hour and other fun activities. Unlike those other so-called North Jersey Meetups that only meetup in Manhattan, this group actually meets in North Jersey.  This group is inclusive and you can define professional however you wish ;D. <br>
results.name: Hudson County Social Professionals

results.description:
For parents who are (or aspire to be) more laid-back than helicopter, more sane than sanitizing, this is a very relaxed group of parents of kids of all ages. We hope to facilitate play time and fun events for the kids as well as support for the parents who struggle to keep a casual approach to parenting in our very high-pressure area (hello, PRESCHOOL admissions process?!). We will have a mix of kid-friendly and grown-up-only events, which will mainly take place in the Cobble Hill, Boerum Hill, Carroll Gardens, and Brooklyn Heights in Brooklyn. though parents from all over the New York area are welcome to join us. Meetups will likely take place in evenings and on weekends. 


Group Rules

We want to create a supportive environment for parents. That means we will always strive to treat each other and any kids present at any Meetups with kindness and respect. Since our particular goal is to encourage an easy-going spirit, please hold back on sharing parental criticisms and critiques. Come to events with an open mind.

Out of respect for the organizers and other members of the group, please honor your RSVP. If something comes up and you cannot make a Meetup which you have said you will attend, make every effort to update your RSVP or send a note to the organizer to let them know.
results.name: Cobble Chill Parents

results.description: Hi all, this is a group for Chinese conversation. Everyone is willing to practice with each other and with a Mandrain Chinese native speaker. I teach Chinese 15+ years, and graduated from the“Chinese Teacher Training Program”in 2008. You should be able to speak and understand at least a little Chinese or you won't be able to participate the conversation. In this Meetup, every week I choose a different topic as a starting point for our conversation. I will post the topic on each Meetup page at least one day before the Meetup. If there is more than one meeting in a week, it will be the same topic, you can try once again or attend next week for the new topic. I will use part of textbooks or media videos to help discuss. RSVP required. RSVP closed the day before every meetup. Min. 2 people, max. 10 people per Meetup (+ me). RSVPs are final: RSVP only if you can come. If something comes up and you can't make it please change your RSVP to "no" so I know who is coming. All meeting will be around Middle East Manhattan. But if you recommend some nice places as well, please do tell me. ---- What's more, there are 3 kinds of Chinese classes that I can offer: -Business: focus on the field that you work in. -Travelling: training of the communication of daily life. -Specialize/Academic Conference: shortly translation, speech training,etc. For private lessons please contact me personally. Thank you. Sarah
results.name: Mid Chinese Conversation Meetup

results.description: This group is for dancers, former dancers, and dancers-at-heart who might feel too intimidated to take class at Broadway Dance Center, but want more from their dance experience than just a work-out. Every Toastmasters journey begins with a single speech. During their journey, they learn to tell their stories. They listen and answer. They plan and lead. They give feedback—and accept it. Through our community of learners, they find their path to leadership.

The core team activities include our three weekly workouts, our team races, and our monthly and post-race social events. Additionally, we maintain an online message board and distribute a weekly member e-mail to keep all team members tied together. We encourage anyone interested in finding more about the Harriers to come to one of our workouts or social events and meet some of the friendly team members.

results.description:
The School of Driving hosts monthly drawing events in various areas around NYC. These are free events that are held in public places, some of which have entry fees but that won't break the bank. We meet and draw at inexpensive venues such as the AMNH, the Met, the Bronx Zoo, Grand Central Station, and so on. Mid-day and end of the day work showings and optional critiques are offered. All ages and levels of drawing/painting experience are welcome to participate. 

Originally, this group began as an homage to the late, great artist and teacher, Jeffrey K. Fisher, as a way for his students to continue in the creative path that he laid out before us. The School of Driving continues in his honor as an open forum for anyone interested in expressing themselves, creating new works, and sharing skills and ideas. Join The School of Driving to draw, paint, sketch, doodle, and make some new art-type friends.

Join us on the fbook, too:  The School Of Driving

Follow us on the Instagram: @theschoolofdriving

Contact us directly at: TheSchoolOfDriving@gmail.com

Lewis, Organizer

Cyclists, runners and triathletes are super dedicated to following their respective training programs, but we are not always so great when it comes to the strength training element of our regimen. This is a group created and led by a fitness trainer with twenty years of experience working with endurance athletes and who has participated in bike races throughout the country and in Italy. 

This group offers endurance athletes a structured, fun and effective environment for implementing sport specific strength training in a small group setting that provides support, camaraderie and improved performance. 

Our sport specific training will include functional, body weight, core, dumbbell, TRX and plyometric training. You don't have to know what all that means, just know that we will offer a great workout consistent with each participants current fitness level and desired results, in an energizing, empowering environment.

And unlike normal NYC comedy shows that are often a 2 1/2 hour commitment, at our shows you can come and go as you please. It's a great time out, a great way to meet people, and it's FREE.

results.description: By using movement improvisation, meditation and dharma art, we begin to listen to the innate impulses in our bodies and start a dialogue with our deeper, authentic selves. Within this work, we access the deeper aspects of our true nature and start the journey of inherently trusting our intuitive sense. This sense of trust not only manifests within the practice, but also permeates throughout the rest of our lives. This kind of attention to the body changes the way we habitually think and react. It encourages us to develop the skills of deep listening, witnessing, and compassion with our inner selves as well as with others. The beauty of this practice is that it can be practiced by anyone with a willingness to show up and be present. There’s no need to be a “dancer” or an “artist” or etc. By simply showing up and being present, so much work has already been done. We can all participate in this way.

Chapter of Global Internet Startups Meetup group (GIS), New York Internet Startups was founded in January of 2016 and it is one of the fastest growing startup communities in USA.

Our events empower entrepreneurs by connecting people and creating opportunities for companies to develop new businesses, meet customers, launch new products, promote their brands and expand their markets.

Our Meetup group strives to help: Entrepreneurs, Students, Techies, Startups, Investors, Mentors and Advisors.

This group will: Host great events, get you involved, connect people and help you take action.

Join, Participate and Enjoy! ☺

Home to some of USA's hottest startups, New York is an emerging force in the world of innovation. The purpose of this group is to bring together members of the local and international community to support and foster the growth of a thriving startup hub. Let's see how we can collaborate now and in the future to create, sustain and enable new and greater startups.

We are glad to have you on board and look forward to meeting you at one of our frequent events.

Sincerely, 

Jeff Robinson & the GIS Team

results.description:
FinTech.O! is about FinTech. Fintech ONBOARDING. FinTech OPPORTUNITIES. FinTech OUTPUT:MVPs 

FinTech.O! is for Finance professionals seeking an entry point into the technology world (for example, having an interest in becoming coders themselves) AND for Coders who seek an entry point into the Finance Technology world. 

FinTech.O! is the only place where these two worlds can meet-up, discover opportunities and find complementary resources in one place. An ideal member would be a finance professional (say a trader or an analyst who is struggling with excel spreadsheets) who needs technology and programming tools to help him/her get ahead of the firehose of data that needs to be analyzed. An ideal member would be a coding bootcamp graduate who wants to be able to use his/her newly gained programming skills to build FinTech products and tools. Maybe even meet up with financial business professionals to start up a FinTech company. Anyone who has an interest in the juncture of finance and technology is invited.

Finance professionals and coding professionals should join to learn about the needs and capabilities of both sides, and to discover what they can bring to the table. Members can expect at each meetup 

     1. Job openings and sharing of job opportunities from within the group 

    2. A main speaker talking about a FinTech opportunity (eg, in payments, investment technology, lending, remittances, etc. - Although not at the very first few meetups, where we'll be gathering information from the community as to best address its needs)

   3. Followed up by the Finance professionals' perspective on why this is an opportunity and who/what groups would benefit from this 

   4. Followed up by the Tech professionals perspective on what technology stacks might be used and how long an MVP wound take to cobble together 

   5. We expect to also have longer meetings (eg, 4 to 6 hour workshops and even FinTech hackathons) as we grow the group.
results.name: FinTech.O!  Finance Professionals Meeting Programmers

results.description:
Hello! Welcome the word’s first drinking club dedicated to bridging the divide between Republicans and Democrats. Ideally, this Meetup aims to foster meaningful political discussions—and hopefully camaraderie—between people with opposing viewpoints. At the very least, it hopes to bring together people who share an interest in American politics. In order for this Meetup to be successful, we must keep these goals in mind:

1. In order to generate interesting discussions, we need a mix of Republicans, Democrats, and Independents. Preaching to the choir is not as fun—or as constructive—as debating issues. Consequently, since New York City is majority-Democrat, reaching out to non-liberals is a priority.

2. We need good topics to discuss at every Meetup. Topics can be specific or general. Possible topics include: privately-funded healthcare vs. publically-funded healthcare, interventionism vs. isolationism, conservatism vs. mainstream republicanism, Bernie vs. Hillary, Trump vs. the establishment, pragmatism vs. idealism, deportation vs. path to citizenship, flat tax vs. graduated tax, security vs. privacy, mental health reform vs. gun control, voter fraud vs. voter suppression, gerrymandering, student loans, the death penalty, women in combat, the pay gap, drug policy, welfare, the minimum wage, labor unions, education policy, terrorism, Israel, Iran, Syria…

3. We need to be able to respectfully discuss our differences. We’ll see whether alcohol helps or hinders achievement of this goal.

4. We need to not ONLY talk about politics. We also want to get to know each other and make new friends. Alcohol will definitely prove helpful in this regard.

5. We need to welcome people of various knowledge levels. Those with a lot of knowledge need to be both teachers and debaters.

More to come! Start spreading the word!
results.name: Drunk Donkeys & Inebriated Elephants

results.description:
This group is for anyone interested in improving their dancing, like me. Have you ever been told that you have two left feet? Do you often feel like you’re never in time with the music? Do you sit on the sidelines while everyone does the electric slide at Grandpa Bernie’s son’s wedding? Then this group is for you! Beginners, particularly, are welcome. This is a non-judgment space. I started this group because this is my year of “yes.” Yes I can dance! I am removing self-limiting beliefs. I want to overcome the nervousness that comes with moving my body to music. How about you? 

- Social dancing. We will explore various dance styles, and practices.

- Balance, muscle tone, flexibility

- Pilates, yoga

-Caribbean (soca, dancehall and zouk)

- Calming energy i.e meditation.

We are on this journey together. We will leave class feeling accomplished, achieving comfort in body, rhythm, balance and coordination. We will have a greater sense of well being, opening ourselves up to new life adventures. On March 9, let's begin the transformation.

Here is our amazing's choreographer's bio: 

Candace Thompson, a Trinidad and Tobago native, is a dancer, choreographer and certified fitness professional, specializing in personal training and group fitness. Her dance training is extensive, beginning in Trinidad and Tobago, where she received instruction in modern dance and ballet, at La Danse Caraibe under Heather Henderson-Gordon. She is a graduate of Adelphi University's BFA in Dance with the Ruth St. Denis Award for excellence from the dance department, and has gone on to perform Afro-Caribbean, Classical Modern, Modern/Contemporary, Contemporary/Floor Technique, Jazz, Soca and West African. 

In addition to her extensive dancing repertoire she is also an IFTA certified Group Fitness Leader, ACE certified Personal Trainer, Int. Pilates Mat instructor, TRX® Suspension Trainer, TRX® Rip Trainer, TRX® FORCE certified instructor and a Level 1 Kettlebell Concepts Instructor. Candace has taught at gyms around NYC including, Harbor Fitness, Lucille Roberts, Fluid Fitness NY, New You Fitness and Barefoot Tiger. Currently, Candace does in-home training for clients in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens, and teaches Soca and Modern Dance at Mark Morris Dance Center.
results.name: Brooklyn: Dancing for Non Dancers / Mind, Body & Soul

results.description:
Calling all Foreign Language lovers in New York City: does your Spotify list include French classics and Spanish dance hits? Are you constantly trying new wines from small regions of Northern Italy or enjoying a new Cheese from the Bordeaux region of France? We pride ourselves on "cultural immersion learning", anybody can sit at home diving through a textbook, we are much more and together we can immerse ourselves in language 

Company Bio: 

Founded in 2013 by Joe Carson, Andrew Henson and John Matthews: City Speakeasy's mission statement is to Walk side by side with each student on the path to language fluency. We incorporate Culturally Immersive Events with structured in class lessons to efficiently teach students a foreign language in New York City

How do your classes work? 

Our Foreign Language classes in New York City utilize a hands on, effective and immersive approach to learning a language. This is not your old high school class or Rosetta Stone: immerse yourself in language. Our Foreign language classes are tailored for the NYC adult and working professionals, culturally immersive and proven to get you to your goal of foreign language fluency. Make learning a foreign language in NYC the highlight of your week!

What Languages do you teach?

We have French Classes, Italian Classes and Spanish Classes
results.name: City Speakeasy: New York foreign language Meetup

results.description:
"God is living in our cities. The Church is living in our cities..." Those were the words of Pope Francis in his homily at Madison Square Garden last September. It is in that spirit that I am starting this meetup group during this the Extraordinary Jubilee, or Holy Year of Mercy.

This group will have a simple mission: To visit and attend Mass at the various Catholic churches in the city of New York, then get together for fellowship at a local pub afterwards. That's it. No speed dating, speaker series, Bible study, joint socials with non-Catholic groups, or anything else. There are other Catholic groups that have those things covered. But unlike those groups, this group will not be tied to any particular parishes. We will get to experience Mass in as many Catholic churches as we can, as many different neighborhoods as we can, even as the number of Catholic churches in New York dwindles. Many of these churches have amazing stories to tell down through the generations.

This is neither a liberal nor conservative Catholic group so please keep politics out of it. I'm most interested in meeting my fellow Catholic single young and not-so-young-anymore (20s, 30s, 40s) adults, but all ages are welcome.

Keep the words of Pope Francis in mind: "...big cities are a reminder of the hidden riches present in our world: in the diversity of its cultures, traditions and historical experiences. In the variety of its languages, costumes and cuisine. Big cities bring together all the different ways which we human beings have discovered to express the meaning of life, wherever we may be."

If you'd like to celebrate being Catholic in the big city, this group is for you.
results.name: New York Church and a Pub

results.description:
The Thoughtful Gay Man: Where gay men go to grow, connect, & live an authentic life. 

This group is for any gay man who is looking for a little something more. In life. In friendships. In the way you show up in the world. You desire to approach life in a thoughtful manner. Our aim is to encourage, uplift, and guide one another through this journey called life. Our monthly events include:

• Book Clubs: Are you a reader or just looking to make new friends in the city? We'll being reading one book per month. Spring/Summer book club list is coming soon! Our hope is to have a few different book clubs throughout the city and on various nights.

• Gratitude Potlucks: Let's combine eating delicious food and injecting it with a heavy dose of gratitude. Sound good?! This is a great way to meet new people, make new friends, and enjoy some scrumptious food. Bring a dish to share with everyone. Who doesn't love a good potluck?

• Service Projects: Let's do good, together! We want to put together community service projects, where we can serve our community and city. If you know of any organizations in need of some helping hands, please contact me.

• Thoughtful Outings: There's a lot to do and see in NYC..so why not explore with other thoughtful gay men? That could be a movie night, visiting an art gallery, open mic night, or other cultural activity. If you have some activities in mind, please let us know.

results.description:
The Executive Forum traces its roots back to 1931. The club has evolved from the merger of the NYU Finance Club and the NYU Business Forum in 1992. Our members have distinguished themselves in a wide variety of fields including business, finance, communications, education and other professions. Starting with the current 2015/16 season The Executive Forum meets four to five times a year from October to June at The Friars Club (157 East 55th Street). The evening affords an excellent opportunity for our members and guests to partake in a stimulating lecture, exchange information with other members, as well as to invite business clients and colleagues for a pleasant and informative evening. The evening starts with hot appetizers and an open bar, which is followed by a formal presentation on an investing or other topics, and questions and answers.

Past speakers include: Jordan Kimmel, John Paulson, Sam Stovall, Maria Bartiromo, and Liz Claman.

The mission of The Executive Forum is to encourage good fellowship among executives and professionals who are alumni of New York University and other universities, and who are actively engaged in business, finance and related areas. In furtherance of its mission, The Executive Forum endeavors to provide a stimulating platform for expert speakers. The organization also promotes the maintenance of high professional and ethical standards in the practice of national and international business and finance.

Membership for the remainder of the current membership year is $255 which gets you admission to the three scheduled events (March 30, April 28 and June 8) at the Friars Club (157 East 55th Street, Manhattan).  Please send a check to our address below.  Include your name, and contact information. 

Non members and invited guests may attend meetings at the Friars Club for $95 ($85 if invited by a member).

Our mailing address is:

The Executive Forum c/o Theoharis

51-45 74 Street

Elmhurst, NY 11373

(Telephone: 347-840-0660)
results.name: The Executive Forum

results.description: "System and family constellation” is a very effective method for healing your ancestral and family field. With this method we can “diagnose” and make visible the patterns and blockages which have followed us from the past. The most healing approach to those traumas is not to run away and to forget, but to bring them out. Like the vampire that disintegrates into dust when brought out to the sun – the traumatic story, when brought out to the conscious level, stops programming our behavior and becomes a valuable experience and knowledge. This practice will give you a chance to work on your personal problems and to serve as a helper in other people’s constellations. The experience of participating in somebody else's constellation gives you deep knowledge of the family relationship structure. This practice brings valuable wisdom to the participant, opens their heart and vision. The Family Constellation method effectively addresses: • relationship problems • career issues • business and financial difficulties • bodily pain and illness • depression • habitual emotional and behavioral patterns When we experience depression, emotional instability, problems with our relationship or career, a common practice is to search for an answer within the realm of our own views and personal history. However, in some cases these issues arise not from personal history, but from our ancestral memories - from the traumas which happened several generations before us. We perceive such traumas as an atmosphere of pressure, danger or threat which affects our feelings and actions. A person with a traumatized “family field” intuitively feels that his/her family energy is too “heavy” and rejects it, putting a barrier between them and their family energy. In a case like this the negative energies are partially blocked, but the power of the family and ancestors’ blessings are blocked as well. In order to move forward you need to feel safety at your back. It is not easy to understand and heal wounds which came from the past. In many cases, we don’t know what happened generations ago. If we do know some stories we feel they are not too important – we see them as grandmother’s tales of the far past. Those traumas manifest as a tense and heavy atmosphere in our relationships with parents, spouses or kids. They can also manifest as repeated patterns of events in our life. More about Family Constellation: http://www.terrapia.org/#!Family-and-System-Constellation...
results.name: Family Constellation NJ, NY

results.description:
We are a community of success stories who are making their dreams a reality through real estate and we are inspired by people who have made a success of themselves by overcoming challenges.

We are seasoned investors and newbies, brokers and agents, former employees, former and current small business owners, and former corporate professionals who help each other through the good and bad times in the journey to make a better life.

We meet every week. And our Super Saturday workshops are fun and informative wherein we bring in instructors from our other locations across the country and our local team members give presentations about their past and current deals. We discuss a multitude of ideas and strategies such as:

-land buying, fix/flip, seller finance, lease options, probate and more.

-building your asset column so you can stay off the unemployment line.

-traditional vs. alternative financing

-multiple income streams from a rental property

-the proper legal entity to be in to protect your business

-having exit strategies before going into any deal

-paying down your debt using a line of credit, a credit card, or a loan...(which one is better) 

-the right mindset for being a success instead of just making lots of money.

Many of our community members have been able to fire their bosses and since then have been financially independent.

With the dollar constantly losing value ( according to many financial experts) we think it's time to do more than just "save for a rainy day".

Anyone who feels the same way is welcome to join us !

Please RSVP for the location.
results.name: New York to L.I. Real Estate Success

results.description:
The Asian Real Estate Professional Association, Inc. (AREPA) is a non-profit professional association. AREPA was founded to provide a forum for Asians in the real estate profession and for anyone interested in pursuing a career in the real estate profession.

Membership is open to anyone who is interested in the purposes and goals of AREPA. Members include, but are not limited to, owners, property managers, developers, contractors, architects, engineers, attorneys, accountants, and real estate brokers. 

AREPA was formed for several purposes. First, AREPA will educate its members (and the public at large) on various real estate topics and current topics of special interest. Second, AREPA will provide a forum for the discussion of current and emerging issues affecting the real estate industry. Third, AREPA will organize social events for its members, their guests, and interested outside parties to meet and make new professional contacts.

AREPA’s mission is to provide a networking platform for all real estate professionals. AREPA helps its members with challenges and changes in the real estate industry.  

Please visit AREPA's website for more information http://www.arepainc.org/
results.name: THE ASIAN REAL ESTATE PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION

results.description:
Calling all women entrepreneurial spirit and professionals!

Lady Savant is an Elite Women’s Private Society that brings together dynamic women who are committed to living life fully; that is, physically, mentally and spiritually. We believe that who you become in 5 years largely depends on who you associate yourself with and we are so proud of the supportive community of trailblazing women we have evolved into!

----------

We are much more than just a networking group… we are a business camp for entrepreneurs to up-level their skills, a real sisterhood (as in a private society) and well…just a safe place for you to be yourself (an unapologetically awesome woman) .

Our mission is to inspire and empower women to turn their businesses and ideas into successful realities. We are all in this together! We thrive off of surrounding ourselves with other like-minded, positive, enterprising women who are in it to win and we know you will too. Being an entrepreneur is not easy, but you already know that. This is your tribe. The ladies who will cheer you on, give you ideas, resources, connections,support and lots of love and laughter.

We know that sometimes you talk to yourself, ask yourself questions, answer them, giggle to yourself, and admit it… sometimes you cry. We’ve been there!!

We host private events online and in person, workshops and conferences. You will meet some of the coolest women you’ve ever met, increase your knowledge to get your business thriving and giving you what you deserve, freedom.

We believe every woman should Envision her story, Explore life with friends and Evolve by manifesting her dreams into reality. Life is too short.

I think we covered the gist of it but if you want to know more about what you will get every month as a member, go here!


Visit us at www.ladysavant.com
results.name: Elite Women's Society: Lady Savant, New York City Chapter

results.description:
I found myself thinking there’s no way I am the only new woman to the area or girl who lost touch with friends over the years or even found myself sitting in my home thinking maybe I should get a hobby? So, I figured why not start a group for other ladies who are looking to get out there and be social. We are a fun versatile group of women where we can all be organizers, throw out ideas of things to do and revamp our social lives while making some new friends in the area with common interests or maybe find new interests we never even knew we had! We do everything, book clubs, crafting, dinner, wine and cheese parings, movie night or just a good ol’ ladies night filled with good conversation. Whether it be a small group or a large one there are always plenty of laughs to be had!

results.description: This Group is for people who always wanted to learn how to dance salsa but didn't know where to begin. We offer affordable classes that are cycle-based. Each class teaches you the next logical step in the learning process and we practice it thoroughly and review it the next week. That way, even if you missed one class, you will be able to catch up. Unlike other places, we do not charge you ahead of time. That is, you pay as you go. If you take 1 class, you pay for that class, period. this way, you do not have to pay if you missed one class. Our classes are affordable and offer a longer duration for the price. We teach Salsa on2, New York Style, which is what is danced in New York city and other places. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!

It's simple because it's based on the proven concept of "what goes around, comes around." If I help you, you'll help me and we will both benefit as a result. Would you like to increase your business by 20%, 30%, 50% or as much as 100%? You can see results like this! Many have. Some participants have added as many as 50 new clients in the first 2 years!!!

In 2010, Business Network Int'l passed over 6.5 million referrals in 5500+ chapters with over 135,000 members in 45 countries resulting in more than $2.8 billion in business!

if you have any types of complaints about anything.

if you're willing to help relieve or solve a problem and define whether the "problem" is a public problem (solvable) or a personal problem (whining). 

= examples of public vs personal =

-public: crying is soo stressful, humidity is distracting, keyboards seem wrong, i'm growing too much hair, january sounds stupid
-personal: i hate the colour red, hair smells, january sounds stupid 


open to change and willing to change for the better (which are two slightly different things), and may potentially work in groups, willing to help others 

if anyone wants to vent, they are welcome, but there will be a limit to the amount of venting present during each meeting (as venting is not aimed at solving, though solutions may result, regardless). 

the goal of these meetings is to experience perspectives and collaborate to define solutions to problems (complaints) {we aim to fix}. 

solving problems mentally and conceptually, with the potential for physicalizing. 

by accepting complaints and helping others, you help yourself down the road. we are all selfish creatures, but we don't have to be inconsiderate. 

share information to solve problems faster. 


Part Thinktank, Part Therapy.

This is NOT a channel to any "officials", though one may meet another who is connected (just like randomness on the streets).

results.description:
mürmur. is a recorded conversation between two strangers.

---------------------------

Often Asked Questions.

1. "How can I be on the show?"  

-Everyone is welcome! There are no background checks of any kind.

 2. "So, what will we talk about?" 
-Anything, and everything. Whatever that comes up naturally in the moment. 

3. "Do I have to prepare ahead of time?" 
-When meeting a friend, do you plan the topics to be discussed ahead of time? 
I would assume the answer is No! And mürmur is no different. 

4. "Is it like an interview?" 
-Nope! It's not an interview. It's a conversation.

5. "Can I say anything I want?" 
-Absolutely. You can even curse like a sailor if you want to.

6. "I don't know if I'm interesting enough." 
-Not true. Everyone has lived through a few amazing life experiences. As long as you're truthful and sincere, that's interesting enough for me.

7. "I want to promote my (band, product, business), can I talk about it on your show?" 
-Yes, and no. If you're coming on mürmur with the purpose of promoting, then you're missing the whole point! 
For instance, I realize that if you're a musician, it's very likely that we will stumble upon the topic of music at some point during our talk. It's inevitable! But let's not make it the focal point of the entire chat. 

And besides, the podcast is simply not large enough at this point to earn you many new fans. 

8. "OK. So, it's kind of like an in the moment conversation between two strangers." 
-Yes!

9. "Cool, I think I'd like to come. May I bring a friend along?" 
-While I do have an open door policy, unless special assistance or care is necessary, I prefer that the conversations are kept one on one.

10."When will the talk be aired?" 
-About 2 to 5 weeks. Feel free to check the Facebook, Twitter, or iTunes page for updates. 

11. "Oh also, how do I know when we start recording?" 
-Usually at some point after sitting down, I'll go and hit record. You'll be able to see the sound waves going up and down on the computer screen. I figure it's better to jump right in instead of creating a "deer in the headlights" sort of moment!

Contact: 347- 717 - 9749 / www.murmurtalk.com / Twitter: @murmurpodcast / e-mail: heartmurmur@outlook.com 

Address: 533 East 5th Street, 10009 (East Village / Manhattan)
results.name: mürmur.

This is a group for adult men that would like a Sounding Board for their life struggles and successes, whether that be work, marriage or relationship issues. But times have changed and our roles as men have changed also. Many of us are not satisfied with just working day in and out, and being thought of as neanderthal creatures without feelings. We do feel, we often just shove it down and keep on going/working. There there is an emotional price to pay, as that Emotional Closet you shove things in will get full, and bust open if not allowed to express itself, vent and find a Forum to be accepted and also seek Guidance from a A Council of Men Good Men. I'm sure we will also share coffee, beers or a good pool/dart game along the way!

Meetings will probably take the form of individual check-ins, group feedback if wanted, and discussions of different topics when Check-Ins and Feedback are done or not warranted.  No one will be forced to join.  And all members will accept a Confidentiality Clause that says "What gets said in the group will stay in the group."

results.description:
The power of Choice! SMART stands for Self-Management And Recovery Training.

SMART Recovery is the leading self-empowering addiction recovery support group (an alternative to AA). Our participants learn tools for addiction recovery based on the latest scientific research and participate in a world-wide community which includes free, self-empowering, science-based mutual help groups.

The SMART Recovery 4-Point Program® helps people recover from all types of addiction and addictive behaviors, including: drug abuse, drug addiction, substance abuse, alcohol abuse, gambling addiction, cocaine addiction, prescription drug abuse, sexual addiction, and problem addiction to other substances and activities. SMART Recovery sponsors face-to-face meetings around the world, and daily online meetings. In addition, our online message board and 24/7 chat room are excellent forums to learn about SMART Recovery and obtain addiction recovery support. If you're new to SMART Recovery, get started with our introduction here.
results.name: West Orange SMART Recovery

results.description: The Rising Strong™ Workshop is a highly experiential methodology based on the research of Dr. Brené Brown, the author of Daring Greatly, Rising Strong and The Gifts of Imperfection. This work is based on the simple physics of vulnerability: If we are brave enough, often enough, we will fall. What does that mean? We all have a story about an experience; a situation, a conversation that made us feel bad, sad, hurt, and ashamed. It can be a story of personal heartbreak, a story from our childhood, a relationship and/or a professional struggle. It's the story where we think we are not good enough; smart enough, thin enough, or even not worthy of being loved. That we’re a bad friend, parent, spouse, boss, son, or daughter. When we don't resolve these feelings, they stop us from having courage in our day-to-day lives. Who should take this workshop? This work is for anyone that wants to: - Explore a story of struggle - Get curious about the emotions that keep us stuck in our story - Learn how owning our story of struggle gives us the power to write a brave new ending How does Rising Strong work? The work is broken down into three acts and is facilitated through discussion, video and written exercises. Act I: The Reckoning – We Walk Into Our Story. Act II: The Rumble – Owning Our Story. Act III: The Revolution – Process Becomes Practice. We write a new ending to our story based on our key learnings and use this new, braver story to change how we engage with the world and to ultimately transform the way we live, love, parent, and lead
results.name: Rising Strong: Let's write a new ending to our story

Why "People Magazine"? Well a friend used to joke with me that "People" is my bible. I can't really debate this as it is indeed one of my most favorite guilty pleasures. Most of the shows I've watched, movies I've seen and books I've read...over the past 20 years have resulted from the featured suggestions found in the magazine . For me it's always been an extremely reliable source of pics that match my personal taste.

The purpose of this book group is to appeal to others who also enjoy reading the same kinds of books I like (they don't necessarily need to be featured in "People") so that we can have a relatively easy time selecting books that matches our collective taste of primarily pop fiction (along with some non fiction/memoirs...) which we all can agree on and feel happy about.

Ideally we will meet monthly at a somewhat easy to get to central location for a group discussion. Below is a list of some books that have been previous featured pics to give you an idea of the types of books we will be reading. 

Looking forward to meeting you.


Orphan Train, Christina Baker Klin

results.description:
Anyone else in the East Village or neighboring areas interested in the ancient prayers of the Christian tradition?

My vision for this group is to see people gather in homes or Tompkins Square Park throughout the year to pray through the rich texts of established trinitarian Christian prayer books like the Book of Common Prayer (BCP) or the psalms. For Christians and non-Christians alike, these texts offer beautiful ways of expressing our needs, hopes, fears, and desires, and require no mustering of poetic language or contriving penitence. Instead, one can authentically pray through the words carefully chosen throughout preceding generations, tested and proved trustworthy. One example is Compline, found here (http://justus.anglican.org/resources/bcp/Compline&amp...) a rich liturgical way to end a day alone at home or in the communal company of others.

This is a new Meetup, so please contact me if you have any questions, suggestions or input!

Peace of Christ,
Drake
results.name: East Village Common Prayer
